vendors.name: Accidental Gentleman
vendors.description: Accidental Gentleman values the uniqueness and creativity of individuals, groups, and organizations. It is the company’s mission to provide opportunities for self-expression through variety and customization of neckwear.

vendors.name: Light and Ink
vendors.description: Lisa Lewis’ love of nature inspired the creation of Light & Ink. Born from an effort to preserve a segment of a beloved tree from her childhood home in Oregon, her goal now is to capture a piece of nature and transform it into a lasting work of art. Also springing from her love of working with all things natural, her uniquely designed wood air plant holders, side tables, and cutting boards were created to bring a bit of modern beauty to everyday life.

vendors.name: Vintau
vendors.description: Curator of vintage finds and gorgeous minerals I am inspired by the beauty of nature's textures and colors. I love creating pieces that invoke wonder, happiness and awe. Coming from a long line of rock hounds, it is fascinating to tap into the lovely detail that minerals exude as well as up-cycle forlorn vintage pieces.

vendors.name: Hydri Home Design
vendors.description: Hello! I am Chelsea Munger owner of Hydri Home Design. I make and sell pillows that have felt letters and sayings on them. I hand cut all the felt letters and machine sew them unto the pillow. Hydri pillows are a fun and simple way to detail and personalize any space with a letter or phrase.

vendors.name: Filanthropik: Threads of Humanity
vendors.description: Filanthropik: Threads of Humanity is about brightly colored artisan sandals made in Guatemala purchases with a conscience and sold for a cause.

vendors.name: Engineers Without Borders at the University of Utah
vendors.description: Engineers Without Borders USA builds a better world through engineering projects that empower communities to meet their basic human needs and equip leaders to solve the world’s most pressing challenges. Our 14,700 members work with communities to find appropriate solutions for water supply, sanitation, energy, agriculture, civil works and structures.

vendors.name: Spy Hop Productions
vendors.description: Spy Hop's mission is to mentor young people in the digital media arts to help them find their voice, tell their stories, and be empowered to affect positive change in their lives, communities and the world.

vendors.name: Colunga Art
vendors.description: I am a full-time mixed-media artist from Ogden, Utah. I specialize in pop culture portraits. I've been painting ever since I can remember. Many of my art pieces are inspired by the classic horror genre, which I love. My work utilizes a variety of mediums, including collage, India ink, acrylic, pen and charcoal.

vendors.name: GLITTERGUTTERGLAMOUR
vendors.description: GLITTERGUTTERGLAMOUR is a local jewelry line devoted to providing bold, highly energetic jewelry pieces with the intent of empowering & uplifting women that wear it. We are committed to bringing edgy, graphic items that attract positivity & love from all around. GX3 is known for bright colors, powerful geometric imagery, and flashy symbolism. Each piece we design is specifically designed with love & passion to uplift your spirit.

vendors.name: Fresh Pressed Prints
vendors.description: I started screen printing to create gifts for expecting friends and family. As my experience grew I began making shirts for my own boys. I love the idea of sparking creativity in young minds through my designs, and specialize in boys' shirts. All my designs are hand-drawn by myself and screen printed onto tees.

vendors.name: Make Salt Lake
vendors.description: We foster innovation by providing access to state of the art tools like 3D printers, laser cutters and CNC mills. Make Salt Lake is bringing people together from diverse disciplines, creating a pool of talent that shares experience, and thus elevating the output of our members.

vendors.name: Deb Day Newey
vendors.description: With my degree in Interior Design and years of kitchen design work sitting on the back-burner while I raise two wild little artists of my own, I've some how managed to find time to indulge my restless artist side.  Watercolor has become my medium of choice, and nature my subject.  I love bringing the beauty of the natural world indoors and on to my walls.  I strive to create contemporary designs that would compliment any home.

vendors.name: Palate Polish
vendors.description: small batch 5-free and vegan nail polish line with food inspired names

vendors.name: Impartworks
vendors.description: I have a predilection for functional art and a knack for unusual designs. A mild undiagnosed case of childhood OCD has evolved into an eye for calculated asymmetry. I use primarily reclaimed and recycled materials for a number of reasons, notably for their inherent character. I haven't limited myself to one style or function of art; rather I design and create on impulse based on the materials and inspiration on hand.

vendors.name: La Barba Coffee Roasting/Levi Rogers
vendors.description: La Barba Coffee Roasters are dedicated to serving single-origin, specialty coffee that is sustainably grown and ethically sourced. All of our coffee's are distinct and regional with an emphasis on varying flavor profiles. We exist in and for Salt Lake City and it's growing and diverse food and beverage scene. Drink up.

vendors.name: PK Clean
vendors.description: PK Clean envisions a world of zero landfill - where each waste stream becomes a resource. One of the most harmful types of waste is plastic – since it never decomposes. Our sustainable process converts plastics into a light and cleaner fuel, with a high energy payback and zero toxic emissions. PK Clean’s first facility is located in Salt Lake City, where we work with local recyclers to take their low-value plastics. We are next targeting other locations and waste streams, including ocean-bound plastics and developing countries.

vendors.name: Tiny Tot Threads
vendors.description: Haley, the owner/designer/seamstress behind Tiny Tot Threads, is from a lake town in upstate New York. She moved to Utah in 2010, where she lives now, happy up against the mountains. With a passion for sewing and a little 'baby fever', Tiny Tot Threads was born in August of 2013. Haleys goal is to provide comfortable handmade pieces for the fashion forward baby.

vendors.name: The University of Utah Entertainment Arts and Engineering Program
vendors.description: The Entertainment Arts & Engineering program at the University of Utah is the #1 Game Development program in the country! We bring together artists, engineers, designers, and producers to make games. Our games run the spectrum from 3D runners to 2D platformers, to Oculus Rift horror to medical games and apps.

vendors.name: Mountain Mehndi
vendors.description: Mountain Mehndi offers exquisite henna body art applied by the area's leading professional mehndi artists who excel in both traditional folk art patterns as well as contemporary body art styles.  We use only fresh-made, 100% natural henna free of chemical dyes, preservatives, and nut products.

vendors.name: Michael Beck
vendors.description: I am a maker that moved to Salt Lake City from San Francisco.

vendors.name: Kirsten Taylor
vendors.description: Kirsten Taylor was born and raised in North Texas.  Influenced by both her father and mother’s creative talents she became interested in drawing and painting at a young age.  She attended Baylor University where she received her BA in Studio Arts.   She spent a year after graduating from Baylor, working at a pottery shop and taking classes at a community college.  She moved to Utah in 2012 to start her post-baccalaureate studies in ceramics at Utah State University.  Having completed her time at USU, she now works out of her home studio in Logan.  She fills her spare time with her love of nature and the outdoors.

vendors.name: Street Bauble Inc
vendors.description: I help people turn their creative imaginations into wearable art. Working with customers I create unique jewelry in sterling silver and 14k gold filled, allowing them to enhance their own beauty with high quality, professional jewelry pieces that will last for years.  Creating jewelry is a personal thing for me. Through my jewelry a part of me is exposed. My father was my mentor and a perfectionist. He would sooner throw a piece out then let a less than perfect project leave his studio. The challenge becomes balancing customers ideas with an eye for art and beauty. I relish the opportunity to give something real, made by my own hand, a piece of myself, to a customer and in so doing forever connect us in a way nothing else could.

vendors.name: MEILAI RAGS
vendors.description: At Meilai Rags we deconstruct your unwanted garments and resurrect them. Our mission is to create one of kind pieces  for the chic, fearless, trendsetting individuals: vagabonds of fashion who refuse to follow the crowd and set their own personal style. We do not mass produce any of our garments. Everything is made from a small production in the U.S. using materials found at Americas wastelands. Each garment is made individually for you from vintage fabrics. We bring exclusivity to your wardrobe. So when your friend  says ”I want one just like that!” you can kindly say…… Sorry, I'm the only one that owns this.

vendors.name: Steampunk Bijou
vendors.description: I make unique pendants, necklaces, rings, money clips, tie clips, bracelets and now cuffs, from upcycled, antique pocket watches and vintage keys. Every piece is hand made by me and absolutely on of a kind!

vendors.name: Studio: Wildflower
vendors.description: Hi my name is Chelcie!  I make furniture, signs, and other fun home decor. Everything is designed, and fabricated by me. Custom orders are greatly accepted.

vendors.name: DevMountain
vendors.description: DevMountain is an industry-leading code school nestled in the heart of the Rockies, founded by fellow developers & designers.  Our community loves sharing their craft and empowering the next wave of makers and thinkers. LEARN - LIVE - BUILD - GIVE

vendors.name: Indulge Eats
vendors.description: Indulge Eats is a Salt Lake City-based bakery that specializes in bite-sized sweets. Gooey caramels, fluffy marshmallows, rich chocolates, and everything in between. All of our treats are made from scratch using locally sourced ingredients whenever possible. From delicate to decadent, we have the right indulgence for you.

vendors.name: Desert Rose
vendors.description: Desert Rose is a jewelry line consisting of delicate yet distinctive pieces created by Malinda Fisher in the heart of Salt Lake City, Utah. Every piece is handmade with love from raw metals and collected stones from various deserts in the southwest.

vendors.name: SLUG Magazine
vendors.description: SLUG Magazine, an acronym for Salt Lake UnderGround, is one of Utah's longest running and most experienced independent magazines. Since 1989, SLUG has provided coverage of Utah's thriving alternative and underrepresented cultures, and continues to expand its coverage as local music, art, action sports, food, technology and entertainment communities develop and grow. Always responsive to its readership and industry trends, SLUG Magazine has branched out online with exclusive content, festival coverage, photo galleries, a podcast and complete archives of all their issues available on SLUGMag.com.

vendors.name: HELLBENT CLOTHING
vendors.description: HELLBENT clothing is a line for all you fun, punk rockin, 90's lovin, gothic rockin and grunge wearin badass women and men out there! Upcycled and remade vintage threads!

vendors.name: BundleLove
vendors.description: Our blankets are perfect for keeping your baby cozy and warm while on the go. Whether in the car or in the stroller, our blankets are designed to stay put. At Baby Bundle Love, all our blankets and accessories are hand made with care and caution. We know how important it is to make sure our product lasts and can withstand the wear and tear of daily use. Baby Bundle Love Blankets are all made with fabric that will be gentle on your baby's skin.. No more harsh fabrics from carriers to irritate your baby's delicate skin. All Baby Bundle Love blankets come prewashed and ready to use the day it arrives. You won't have to worry about harsh dyes or chemicals irritating your baby's skin. Because we prewash all our fabrics before sewing them., you won't have to worry about them shifting, warping, or dyes bleeding. We know that baby items need to withstand washing time and time again. While we offer a variety of styles to meet our client's and the market's demand, we understand that sometimes it is nice to have something uniquely you. We offer custom orders as well to tailor to your unique style preference. We know those blankets fall, over and over and over again. they get caught in wheels they get dragged through dirty parking lots, and dropped on filthy store floors. With bundle love you know that the blankets will stay put. Bundle Love blankets slip on easily over your carrier or stroller seat... Straps easily thread through blanket slits so the buckle can securely fasten without compromising the safety of the seat. Blanket can then swaddle around your child safely and comfortably. No more worrying about bulky coats and blankets getting in the way of straps. and compromising your baby's safety. Bundle love's hooded designs, are cute, unique and add extra protection to your little one from outside elements.

vendors.name: Neuer Geist
vendors.description: Art prints, posters, handmade gifts. Where print lives on and coffee is lifeblood.

vendors.name: Jonathan Christensen
vendors.description: Jonathan Christensen received his B. F. A. from Utah State University with an dual emphasis in ceramics and sculpture. His artwork is divided into two main focal points; utilitarian vessels and figurative sculptures. He continues to live in Logan and now works as the Shop Technician for USU's Sculpture Lab.

vendors.name: City Grounds
vendors.description: We are Utah's best Cold Press, Nitro Brewed Coffee Trike.  Every bean is ground and pressed to perfection.  We pride ourselves on using only the finest bean and most coarse grind available to anyone.  City Grounds offers full service delivery and is 100% mobile all the time.  We are the One True Cold Brew. We are carried by Higher Ground Coffee (3300 s 2000 e) We have a growler exchange program as well as bottles for sale.  We cater birthdays, weddings, parties!! Etc.  Email us for pricing and availability.

vendors.name: Olive Deer
vendors.description: My name is Amanda. I am the owner and maker of Olive Deer, where I design unique and one-of-a-kind jewelry. I work out of my basement studio with my french bulldog assistant by my side. When I'm not creating jewelry you can find me annoying my boyfriend, eating a delicious bowl of pho, or napping.

vendors.name: Cain and Cable
vendors.description: My name is Annie Cain and I am the owner and operator of Cain & Cable. I create hand knitted products. My mother taught me how to knit 7 years ago, and her mother taught her how to knit. I fell in love with knitting and I am rarely seen without knitting needles in my hands. I am a school teacher, and I naturally enjoy sharing my talents with others. This year I have created knitting kits to spread my love for knitting and DIY products.

vendors.name: Go Make Play Project Kits
vendors.description: Go Make Play is the creation of husband and wife team Even and Elise (and of course their two kids helped along the way!). Even - a veteran educator who has taught and entertained kids all across America - and Elise - a graphic designer and artist - bring their love of imagination and creativity to every hand made kit. Even and Elise started offering their kits at their summer camps. The impact they had with the children was so great that the demand quickly grew beyond the camps. Now they’ve put together the most popular kits and made them available for anyone, anywhere to share the experience with their kids. Every kit contains everything you need and is easy to assemble. Our kits engage and teach while providing a creative and individual experience for every kid. Every kit contains reclaimed or repurposed wood and materials.

vendors.name: Alexis Mattox Design
vendors.description: Alexis Mattox is a designer and entrepreneur who creates beautiful stationery, wedding, and party goods. Her company started as a hobby, but before long she started receiving national recognition for her designs. Her products have been carried by companies such as Urban Outfitters, BHLDN, David's Bridal, Dillard's, The Knot and hundreds of small shops worldwide in the few short years since it began. Alexis has worked with many companies to create exclusive collections and to license her artwork.

vendors.name: Browning-Smith Art
vendors.description: Nancy Browning-Smith has been bringing art and science to Elementary students along the Wasatch front as a visiting artist for twenty years, teaching paper mache fish sculptures. She changes mediums regularly and has worked with everything from yarn  to metal. Her latest work is with glass and metal, creating found object sculptures: robots, angels, fairies, ballerinas and more. Often Nancy's inspiration comes from the  materials themselves as she gathers discarded objects to which she gives new life.

vendors.name: Clairabells
vendors.description: Painting is my happy place.  I love to have a brush in my hand and to be found creating.  I hand paint wooden peg dolls.  I have many play sets that become a keepsake in the home.  I also create custom families to display.

vendors.name: Ingredients For Lovely
vendors.description: Jessie and her husband/business partner, Wes, started Ingredients For Lovely on a whim and as a creative outlet in their busy lives. Newlyweds both making minimum wage, they started selling jewelry and jewelry supplies online. Working from their tiny condo, after their days jobs and late into the nights, they persisted and were committed to their new shop!  They later took the big risk by quitting their jobs and becoming self-employed!  Today Jessie and Wes live in Layton with their little boy, Max. They enjoy art, furnishing their new home and spending time with their families. They love being part of the creative community and enjoy supplying people with their own Ingredients for Lovely!

vendors.name: Elf Couture
vendors.description: I Incorporate ancient artisan leather working techniques into original designs to create usable works of art. I am inspired by nature, utility, traditional folk art, and an obsession for quality. I use repurposed and upcycled leather to create minimalist shoes, handmade bags, and jewelry. I strive to infuse art into everyday wearable objects that can be tailor made for the individual resulting in a perfect blend of form and function.

vendors.name: Dusk Raps
vendors.description: SLC based multi faceted creator of art & music

vendors.name: Love Lynsey
vendors.description: Lynsey Schlegel is a woodworker and maker living in Salt Lake City, Utah. Originally from Arizona, she attended Arizona State University and has a BS in Industrial Design. Lynsey developed her passion for building, manipulating materials and creating dimensional spaces while working as a display artist. She has taken her collective experience in design and display to form her own unique style and point of view. Lynsey's aesthetic is inspired by contrasts and the manipulation of honest materials to create a refined and modern result with a touch of the unexpected. She sources her materials locally and when possible loves to work with found or repurposed materials.

vendors.name: Gheybin Comish
vendors.description: Gheybin Comish was raised here in Utah by an artist mother and pilot father. Born in 1983, her early years were filled with drawing, animals and travelling. As a child she was nurtured by her mother’s love for oil painting and father’s . Comish attended Utah Valley University for a BFA in painting and drawing. Her work themes center around animals and their connections, native drawing and culture, spirits and folklore, and extreme emotions.  She currently works and resides in Salt Lake City.

vendors.name: Hook'd Crochet
vendors.description: I've been crocheting for over a decade and I've been selling pieces locally for six years. I use my own patterns, so crochet is my way to bring what's going on in my imagination out into the world. I enjoy nothing more than to see something, imagine it in yarn form, and puzzle it out.  I'm originally from Alabama and moved to Utah from Idaho fifteen years ago.  I recently brought my teenage niece, Sophie, on as my apprentice, so look out for her- she's already an amazing crocheter!  Aside from my awesome life as a Craft Lake City artist, I run a small monthly arts & crafts show, Craft Sabbath, and have contributed to three crochet books.
vendors.categories: Children's Items, Knit Items, Sewn Accessories

vendors.name: Winding Wheel Supply Co.
vendors.description: After nearly a decade of life on the American road as a touring musician, a change of pace was in order for Kenny Bozich. Inspired by his travels, Kenny created Winding Wheel Supply Co. with the aspiration to lead a quiet life & work with your hands. All Winding Wheel Supply Co. products are made by hand in Salt Lake City, Utah. This means that every piece starts with a blank slate; it is designed, cut and hand stitched, ensuring that every piece that leaves the shop is built to last.

vendors.name: fullgive
vendors.description: Scott has been creating with his hands his entire life. He learned to sew in a home economics class in Junior High School, and has sewn everything from furry ski hats to skydiving jumpsuits. He quit his job four years ago to fully invest in his current passion – Fullgive Leather – where he designs, makes, and sells his handmade leather goods for a living. A Utah native, Scott also has a passion for wrenching on vintage Landcruisers, adventuring around the globe, and generally living an unconventional lifestyle.

vendors.name: Lot801
vendors.description: A children's brand for the unorthodox family. Lot801 strives to create unisex clothing that appeals to both the little punks and the fashionable moms. We like to think of ourselves as the black sheep of children's brands, breaking all the rules. We make our own cool for creative, curious kids that love to explore the world through their own eyes. Who says girls have to wear pink and boys have to wear blue? Why can't the little ones sport black? We believe in letting children be whoever they want to be.

vendors.name: Love Blooms
vendors.description: Shop Love blooms is a shop full of bloomers for the most stylish babes. With styles ranging from vintage to modern, every design is beautifully handmade by shop owner and designer Emily Jane.  She is passionate about using the best fabrics and coming up with new designs to show off all those darling baby legs!!

vendors.name: kekemomo
vendors.description: kekemomo is the lovechild of two sisters who want to help create better homes and bodies. And we choose to do it one candle, soap, lotion, and salve at a time.  We originally began making products for ourselves because, in truth, we were picky. We wanted to use products with incredible scents, clean design, and only natural ingredients. When we couldn't find what we were looking for, we started brewing. Each ingredient we use has a positive purpose and is purchased in our local West, as possible. We also create custom scents and labels for businesses, stores, weddings, and corporate events. Cheers, Kellie (keke) and Morgan (momo)

vendors.name: Pyro Yankee
vendors.description: Pyrography means to write or draw with fire.  That is what I do.  I started my hobby as a way to make inexpensive gifts for friends and family, but have discovered a passion for burning.  I often add color to my burns with Prismacolor pencils, markers, paint or multiple shades of wood stain.  Wood burning is typically seen as an old-fashioned craft for kids, but I have found it to be a beautiful form of art.

vendors.name: Trisha McBride
vendors.description: Triluna is my design label that I have developed over the past 10 years. It has been a labor of love and a blast to give birth to this creative storm I call Triluna. This label embodies everything that I love in my personal fashion realm–from stunning bellydance costumes, to a yoga line that makes me happy to wear when I’m pouring sweat, to casual, high fashion wear that you will want to live in every day. High vibration fashion is woven with love and magic in each and EVERY piece. You can feel the vibrational difference when you put on one of my garments. There is a distinct difference when you wear pieces that are made by people in a high vibe healthy setting vs. items that were made in a sweat shop child labor factory. New to Triluna in 2015 is the Triluna Apothecary line. From potions that are made for magical purposes to balms and baths that are made to shift your state of mind and the energy around you, Triluna Apothecary is there to assist with meditation, protection, love and all of the above.

vendors.name: City of Industry
vendors.description: City of Industry was founded by Sarah Anderson on July 30, 2013. Her dad was her first customer. Raised in Utah, Sarah named the shop after her home state's motto, Industry, and after her second home, New York City, where she found an inspiring community of creative people. Back in Salt Lake City, City of Industry creates products for makers and hobbyists: badges of honor for the people with specific passions, especially those who make things with their hands.

vendors.name: Riley's Farm Fresh
vendors.description: Seeing the need for a value-added service to make a selling apples more viable, Jordan Riley came up with the idea of pressing apple cider. Importing equipment from Italy and armed with a blend of family-grown apples evolving with the change of seasons.After sharing plans, dreams, and hairbrained ideas, Miles Petty started helping Jordan in his purveying of fruit in Salt Lake from the family orchards in Payson. Jordan and Miles became a fixture at the Downtown Farmers Market, pressing the best tasting cider around and coming up with outlandish guarantees that have yet to be challenged. The three had enough fun, enough dreams, and little enough sense that they decided to make it a more permanent endeavor. And so, at our founding location in Holladay, Utah, you can now find the best cider and pie- guaranteed or we’ll cater your birthday.

vendors.name: Peach Treats, LLC
vendors.description: Custom Ear Art, handmade in SLC, UT. One-of-a-kind pieces for stretched lobes, or fakers faux-gauge earrings for regular pierced ears.

vendors.name: University of Utah Printmaking
vendors.description: The prints in this booth have been created by Printmaking students, Alumni and  Faculty, from the University of Utah, and are current and past examples of work specifically made for our annual fundraiser. Each year participants create a series of prints that reflect their particular and diverse interests.  The prints are made in a variety of print mediums including, Etching, Relief printing, Lithography, Letterpress and Screenprinting, and are sold to primarily raise funds for student travel to a national printmaking conference where students gain exposure to an expansive range of artists, new techniques and exhibitions. Funds are also used to assist in bringing visiting printmakers to the department. The artists will create a new edition of prints with the hands on assistance of printmaking majors and these students will gain valuable skills that may later be applied to the creation of their own prints.

vendors.name: Lick'd
vendors.description: We offer gourmet popsicles. These pops are made fresh with as many natural, organic and local ingredients as possible. Some flavors are: plum basil, strawberries and cream, raspberries and cream, peaches and cream, pineapple cilantro, key lime pie, strawberry shortcake, salted caramel, chocolate banana, peanut butter oreo, rosemary peach, mango raspberry lime, blackberry lime, avocado pistachio, honey grapefruit, strawberry basil, coconut,, strawberry mint lemonade...and many more. There are 8 varieties weekly with at least two new flavors making their appearance. We will also make gourmet ice cream sandwiches!!! They are amazing and made with ice cream and sorbet flavors you would never expect to find at the market as well as sandwiches you have never hear of using! Not just cookies, we also use macaroons and rice krispies! New flavors each week. Gluten free option available. These would be a fantastic addition to Craft Lake City. So creative and so delicious.  The people are gonna love them!

vendors.name: The Cheeky Whale
vendors.description: Born and raised in Salt Lake City, married with two kids and two stepkids, love all things vintage, urban exploration photography, fitness, veganism, animals, and of course, illustration.

vendors.name: Butterbean Leather Co.
vendors.description: Butterbean Leather Co. is a husband and wife team based out of Salt Lake City, Utah. We enjoy making our leather goods by hand from start to finish, and we specialize in keychains, hair bows, and natural leather wallets.

vendors.name: Salt City Brew Supply
vendors.description: Salt City Brew Supply has everything you need to brew your own beer, wine, cider, mead and other fermented beverages. Our DIY1G kits are designed to get you started in the hobby of homebrewing, one gallon at a time.

vendors.name: Barbano Glass
vendors.description: Anthony Barbano specializes in fumed glass. A new technique in the glass blowing industry where gold and silver are melted on a torch into the glass, resulting in a surreal and luminescent quality. Barbano's Italian ancestry is evident in his artistry.

vendors.name: Bitters Lab
vendors.description: Utah's first and only Bitters Lab specializing in handcrafted, locally made bitters.

vendors.name: Ken Garff Fiat
vendors.description: Some cars go down in history for their technological or stylistic innovations. Others deserve to be remembered sentimentally for the role they've played in the daily life of an entire generation or country. But few succeed in combining the two - technology and sentiment - and leave an eternal mark. Now in over 80 countries, the FIAT 500 has evolved into a beloved global icon, winning the hearts of passionate drivers, motor journalists and judges alike. Most recently the FIAT 500 won over 60 international awards, including being named 2008 European Car of the Year and 2009 World Car Design of the Year. Additionally, FIAT MultiAir Technology was recognized as the 'Single Most Innovative Engine Technology' of 2010 by the International Engine of the Year Awards panel. Now that's love. At Ken Garff FIAT of Salt Lake we have strong and committed specialists with many years of experience satisfying our customers' needs, and we look forward to the opportunity to introduce you to the FIAT brand!

vendors.name: Salt Valley Vintage
vendors.description: SVV's curatorial strategy targets simultaneously eclectic and timeless vintage pieces, with a special focus on quirky dresses and abstract jewelry.  I give women's clothing and accessories a home in my shop when I see unique narratives woven through their lovely, aged fibers!  When I'm not trolling for vintage treasures, you can find me at my day job in the nonprofit world or working on freelance blogging projects.

vendors.name: Most Adoringly
vendors.description: I have been selling my jewelry and art at Utah festivals for the past five years. I strive to make unique, chic, modern, and dainty jewelry. I am inspired by color and geometric shapes. My creations are constantly evolving into something new!
vendors.categories: Jewelry, Mixed Media, Painting, Photography, Vintage

vendors.name: Robyn Braegger
vendors.description: Hand crafted, uniquely designed sea creatures.  Each one is different.  Made without patterns.  Personality abounds in this garden of sea creatures.

vendors.name: Root + Rise Botanicals
vendors.description: Root + Rise Botanicals is a small, all-natural personal care line that provides a vehicle for relaxation and connection to the natural world. Herbal based products include pregnancy, new mama, little babe, yogi and women care. Root + Rise Botanicals is owned and operated by a mama, Amy Menzel, who makes botanical creations in her kitchen at her home in Salt Lake City, Utah. Amy spent many years traveling to countries in Europe, Asia, and South and Central America, and had observed the disparity between the U.S. systems of health and wellness and others around the world. These experiences awakened a yearning to create more natural wellness in her own life, and share many tools with friends and family. Having a child has fully enlivened her desire to surround herself, and those she cares about, in a loving botanical blanket.

vendors.name: 90.9 KRCL
vendors.description: 90.9fm KRCL is northern Utah’s only non-profit, member-supported public radio station dedicated to broadcasting a well-curated contemporary eclectic mix of music and community information 24 hours a day. KRCL is a non-profit community radio organization, Listeners Community Radio of Utah. Listening to radio is a great way to satisfy your passion for music, while learning something about the music along the way. The best music radio presenters are ones who share their passion with you, and take you on a musical journey every time they open the mic. Each KRCL DJ is a curator, a trusted guide.  KRCL DJs play music you know and love, and surprise you with the occasional song you don’t know or haven’t heard in a long time.  It’s the knowledge and context the DJ brings to his or her show that makes listening to KRCL special and the little stories, anecdotes and bits of information that are peppered throughout  that make it a great listen. While the avenues for music discovery are multiplying, there is an inherent value in KRCL’s brand of radio. KRCL DJs are human beings doing something that an algorithm alone could not do – identifying all kinds of genres, a huge variety of styles and songs, some obscured or out of print, and putting them together in a way that makes sense and touches you emotionally.

vendors.name: Swasey Fashion
vendors.description: Hi! My name is Sara and I own Swasey Fashion. I grew up immersed in the jewelry industry as my dad is a jeweler and owns his own company. At a young age I was sizing rings, winding earrings and learning the details of hand making jewelry. I worked in the shop all through middle school, high school and college. Once I graduated, I set out to find my career but after a few years came back to my roots. I started by own business and have loved every minute of it! I have a passion for jewelry. I love it when someone finds that one piece that makes them feel beautiful. Because isn't that what its all about? Feeling beautiful  everyday!

vendors.name: Melissa Hughston
vendors.description: Just as we are born, live and die, a flower buds, blooms and withers.  All life is forever-changing and my aim is to capture moments within it.  Their lives are so short, yet their movements are so slow. I find this to be an interesting contrast to our lengthy, fast-paced lives.  I hope my flowers also work as a kind of a metaphor to look a little deeper in general.  If you pay closer attention and see the details with a different perspective, you will learn something new and see life a bit differently…perhaps see something you’ve never noticed before.  I have degrees in both illustration and biology and a love for photography, so a few years ago I decided to incorporate these three passions together into a cohesive whole with my botanical mixed-media illustrations.

vendors.name: PenBlade, Inc
vendors.description: Changing the Game - PenBlade is a precision cutting tool with a retractable blade that combines versatility with safety. PenBlade began as a medical safety scalpel.  The company was founded by Dr. Branden Rosenhan, a critical care physician.  He saw the need for safer scalpels in medical settings.  He and his partners took the PenBlade from concept to product and PenBlade went on the market in April of 2014. Since then we have expanded into the retail market selling the PenBlade knife.

vendors.name: IHSQUARED
vendors.description: Isaac Hastings is an illustrator/designer based out of Salt Lake City, Utah. He primarily designs graphics for t-shirts and other apparel. His artwork consists of detailed line work, graphic imagery, geometric designs and desaturated color palettes.

vendors.name: Tenrec Builders
vendors.description: The Tenrec Builders are Jonathon Duerig and Mandy Giles. We are based in Salt Lake City, Utah. We make and distribute book scanner kits. Our goal is to help make sure that ordinary people have access to the technology to make high quality reproductions of the books they own. Whether you want to make a copy of a childhood journal, track the genealogy of your family, or scan a historical document, our scanner kits will help make it happen.

vendors.name: Wendybird Embroidery
vendors.description: Wendybird Embroidery got its start about two years ago when Christina Hall, thread and textile artist, decided to pull out her needle and thread. Raised by a quilting mother, she was used to the feel of a needle in hand, but had never done embroidery before. She loved it, and she was good at it! Since then she's started making her own designs, taking on commissions, and is excited to bring her products to the Salt Lake community! Her embroidery is inspired by nature, vintage designs, illuminated manuscripts, typography, maps, and the space and boundaries we use to divide and delineate our physical lives. She is always excited to try her hand at new techniques. Christina creates embroidered wall art and practical pieces in a range of sizes.

vendors.name: Brown Eyed Quilts
vendors.description: A mom and daughter sharing their love of sewing  with you and yours. Custom crib quilts in the color and pattern of your choosing.

vendors.name: Chloe Monson
vendors.description: Just a little lady rambling through Salt Lake City. Artist, reading enthusiast, earthling.

vendors.name: ElectronLuv
vendors.description: Josh Stippich fell into the business of custom audio manufacturing by accident in 1999. Originally, he owned a recording studio, but became increasingly dissatisfied by the inadequacies of the equipment. He found a cheap pre-amp from the Internet and bought it, stripped it down, then put it back together at home, making a few explosions in the kitchen along the way. Since then, fine-tuning custom amps by ear has been a passion for Stippich. He is a self-taught metal worker, who received a lot of guidance as well as tools from his step-father, a sculptor, to perfect the streamlined art deco design of all his amps and pre-amps. Stippich earned the top Craftsman Award from the Vacuum State of the Art Conference (VSAC) in September 2001. At the conference, Stippich met up with speaker manufacturers Terry and Leslie Cain of the Cain & Cain company, who have championed his products ever since. Electron Luv has grown from a home experiment into a full-fledged company with a worldwide market, with tube enthusiasts from as far away as Thailand buying his equipment. The native Utahn will remain committed to his traditional recipe for success - painstaking attention to detail and craftsmanship - to achieve quality sound.

vendors.name: Candace Jean
vendors.description: Daydreaming away among a miscellany of old books, antiques and gathered woodland findings, Candace crafts images of things both real and imagined in various media. She find inspiration in the Victorian Era, flora and fauna, the works of Old Masters, and children's fairy tales.

vendors.name: Belly of the Beast Beauty
vendors.description: Hello, my name is Olivia. I love up cycling materials to make beautiful combinations. All of my leather work and sewing is done with scraps that would have otherwise gone unused. I also love to collect gently used purses and add my own touch. Our culture is full of waste and inefficiency. I am trying to get in touch with a part of the solution by become creative with the excess. This is just the beginning!

vendors.name: Mineral and Matter
vendors.description: Mineral and Matter is a jewelry and home decor studio and store. Our jewelry collection features classic pieces that are easy to wear with a modern twist.  Our home decor selection include decorative arrows and displays and well as mineral specimens and curio shelves to house them in. We have a studio and store on Pierpont Avenue.

vendors.name: Kevin's Origami
vendors.description: Whether you want to spice up your home décor, give a unique gift to a friend, or make an event unforgettable, Kevin's Origami will make sure your voice and style sense are heard. Kevin is an expert at creating personalized paper designs, and he boasts a collection of colored paper and folded bills that are crafted into anything from favorite animals to complex, interlocking geometric shapes. For those wanting a delicate creation, Kevin creates lovely jewelry or dangling decorations. And if you’re feeling a little more adventurous, he constructs unique works of art for display.

vendors.name: Candy Everything
vendors.description: Boiling sugar syrup is hand poured into metal molds and pops out as tiny elephants, a huge ship, fancy ladies, lions, sailboats, and more, all in sparking, clear hard candy. Traditional clear toy candies are three-dimensional candy figurines handmade from antique molds. These candies are still made in only a few places and we are proud to continue a family tradition that started in 1868. It uses traditional techniques to turn sugar, corn syrup, and water—along with natural flavoring and colors—into figures. Recently Candy Everything has restored a few antique candy roller machines to make drop candy. One of these machines will be on display at their table. Candy Everything puts a new twist on traditional candy with figures, colors, and flavors that delight everyone.

vendors.name: Isabell's Umbrella
vendors.description: Born from a love of illustration, design and an obsession with stationery, Isabell’s Umbrella is a boutique paper goods design studio located in Salt Lake City, Utah. Ashley Giessing, together with her husband, Mathew, make up the creative team behind this brand. All hand-made and homegrown, Isabell’s Umbrella was launched from a basement office in 2008 with a firm belief in the beauty of a handwritten note. The tidy boxes of cards, bundles of tags, and notebooks tied in twine are a true reflection of the care and quality they puts into every one of their items.

vendors.name: Bella Adele Co
vendors.description: At Bella Adele Co., we make hand crafted gold foil prints. All of our designs are hand-drawn, printed, and then gold foiled to add an extra level of beauty to a person's home our nursery.

vendors.name: Tortuga's Design
vendors.description: We are a Mother Daughter team. Our difference in age and style, makes each individual piece unique. Tortuga's Design was born out of our passion to create. It now serves as a platform where we can showcase our creations, an expression of ourselves. Our hopes are to share our inspirations with you.

vendors.name: The Smelly Goat Soap Company
vendors.description: In South Carolina last year, Allison Hutto and Caitlin Wynn started making their own soap to enjoy the health benefits of essential oils and ensure that they were using all natural bath products. They posted photos online and surprisingly, people started asking them where they could buy their soap. Thus began the start of this wife and wife business. They moved to Salt Lake City this year and began adding additional products like lip balm, bath salts, and lotion. Only natural ingredients are used such as coconut oil, hemp oil, shea butter, and coco butter. They are excited to give people the option of holistic remedies and research each essential oil used to make customers aware of it's health benefits. They make everything out of their kitchen, and dream of the day when they can quit their day jobs and focus on The Smelly Goat Soap company full time.

vendors.name: Stephanie Hillman Design
vendors.description: Stephanie Hillman is an artist specializing in functional pottery and fine arts design based out of Salt Lake City, UT. She currently teaches art classes at the Petersen Art Center in Sugarhouse.

vendors.name: 2nd Hand Coast
vendors.description: The mission of 2nd Hand Coast is to provide support to families, victims, and abusers who have been affected by alcoholism. A portion of our proceeds are donated to organizations that help fund rehabilitation progams for those affected by this disease. 2nd Hand Coast makes recycled coasters out of a variety of beverage labels. Our goal is to spread this awareness through the selling of our coasters to every home in America. Keep Coastin!!

vendors.name: Softwire Synthesis
vendors.description: Softwire synthesis is an electronic instrument maker based out of Salt Lake City, Utah. We are currently focused on developing new instrument interfaces in the Eurorack format. We aim to create exciting and playable modules for the sonic dreamer.  All modules are hand assembled using surface mount tech using PCB's manufactured in the Salt Lake valley.

vendors.name: Adnews
vendors.description: For 30 years adnews has brought the players together through creative showcases, news, columns, information, resource directories and profiles – Buyers meet Service Providers. adnews writes to the marcom industry including people who hold positions with influence in the branding, marketing and advertising corporate job titles.  For example, business ownership, CEO/CMO, president, vice president of marketing. Also, executive in the media and owners of supplier-based companies to the industry.  adnews comes into play with your role in communicating directly with not only a targeted industry, but a targeted region that includes Utah and Colorado with plans for expansion. If you take advantage of adnews’ ability to deliver a loyal and specific readership, you will find yourself elevating in recognition and loyalty for your company and its services, brand and products. With today’s demands limiting reading time, it is more crucial than ever to be in the magazine that is considered required reading.

vendors.name: Joshua Flicker
vendors.description: I am a clay artist and teacher who has been living and creating along the Wasatch Front for the last 10 years.  My work is often influenced by the geography, geology, flora, and fauna of this area.

vendors.name: Salt City Emporium
vendors.description: Salt City Emporium is a brand spurred to discover individuality, fascination, comfort and quality in our modern world.  A rebellion from status quo, we give a voice to creativity through clothing and decor for kids. As a design house based in Salt Lake, we have created a successful lifestyle brand that allows the modern family an intriguing destination for style, collaboration and inspiration.  Listening to our customer experiences, we introduce limited exclusive collections based on art, surroundings, and the uncommon.  Our customers know that they will find statement-making pieces that spark confidence and style for themselves, their kids and their homes.  The distinct products are accessible to anyone looking to strike a little extra in the day to day.

vendors.name: Tangents And Tentacles
vendors.description: Growing up I loved the dark humor of Beetle Juice and Edgar Allen Poe and have always seen the world in a different shade of grey. I create what inspires me, and what meets the needs of my clients. Creating items in a home studio allows me to work in a creative surrounding and meet customer demand.

vendors.name: 90.1 FM KUER
vendors.description: It is our fundamental belief that information and public engagement enrich a community. To that end, KUER 90.1 is intensely committed to building a community of world citizens through story and art, discussion and debate, sound and creativity. Our work is driven by our Public Service Mission:  KUER enhances the lives of its audience with a blend of news, information and entertainment in an unbiased, non-commercial context and creates an ongoing source of service and support vital to community organizations.

vendors.name: Parchment and Pallet
vendors.description: Retro Kitschy Goodness. Inspired by classic american retro style. Hand-picked vintage treasures that have a kitschy cute charm.

vendors.name: Fawn Design
vendors.description: Fawn Design was created over a year ago when Jenny had the idea to design and sew the perfect diaper bag. Since then they have been an instant hit! Fawn design ran a successful Kickstarter last year and was able to raise $42,000 in just 15 days. They were also featured in the New York Times in Feburary. This will be Jenny's second year at Craft Lake City and Fawn Design is thrilled to come back!

vendors.name: Skyler Chubak
vendors.description: My name is Skyler Chubak. I am a lettering artist. I work with pen and ink mainly doing work in the style of past Engrossers and Ornamental Penmen mostly from the turn of the century. I write my own stories and illustrate them, I do chalkboards around the city, and work in a few other mediums all calligraphic related.

vendors.name: Brooke Smart Illustration
vendors.description: Brooke Smart is an artist/illustrator living and working in Salt Lake City. Her work is influenced by folk art, pattern making, and her love of people.

vendors.name: Tommy Dolph
vendors.description: My name is Tommy Dolph and I make new stuff out of old stuff. Paintings of pop culture figures on found objects such as chrome semi-truck hubcaps, cardboard and weathered plywood display an obsession with country music, wizards and Halloween. Old keys, wire, and plumbing pieces are transformed into unexpected jewelry. Antique Cigar boxes are reborn as cute little ukuleles.  I show my work in a haunted lemonade stand fashioned from re-purposed antique doors.

vendors.name: AROMASOUL and Co.
vendors.description: Hi, I'm Karey Shane. I'm soon to graduate as a Certified Aromatherapist and just returned from London, where I studied under Robert Tisserand. My mission with AROMASOUL and Co. is to bring peace of mind, body and spirit to the heroes who live with ongoing, invisible (or not-so-invisible) challenges. My very carefully handmade offerings are made with pristine organic or wildcrafted essential oils, waxes, and carrier oils.  Our first beard oil was crafted for bearded veterans. My pain pain balm recipe was a desperate attempt to find relief from my unpredictable spoonie pain, and it works better than anything I've tried in eight years. Stop by to say hello. If I don't have what you hoped to find, let me know, and I'll see what I can do to help you.  We are working hand in hand with Operation Underground Railroad to help rescued children heal. Follow us on our giving trips! Be still. Be kind. Behave yourself.

vendors.name: Spilt Ink
vendors.description: Spilt Ink is a full service Screen Print shop. Everything is done in house which saves you the middle man costs! We can print on almost anything and can help get the items you want to sell or use for promotions. We have NO minimums, fast turn around, and great quality.

vendors.name: Pretty Little Pixel
vendors.description: I have always loved old buildings and signs and saw that many of the signs I loved were disappearing. I wanted to capture them before they were gone. So I started taking photos of them, and rather than hide the flaws and age in the signs and buildings, I try to celebrate the flaws when I digitally illustrate them. It didn’t take long for me to realize, these were more than just signs I thought were beautiful. Everyone has their own story about these places. And I have heard some great ones. I have heard about many nights at Bill and Nada’s,  or how they went to Snelgrove’s,when they were kids, and not to mention the MANY, MANY misadventures at Coachman’s and Bar-X. This is my little way of trying to keep the city from becoming just another place, and keeping it special.

vendors.name: Abraham Von Waffles
vendors.description: A bearded wafflesman with a fascination for all things creative and magick alike. Incorporating woodland magick and elements of folklore and fairy tale into each and every creation, exercising traces of nostalgic nerd culture as well as occult and witchcraft. Conflicted and curious, self taught Abraham Von Waffles spends time experimenting in and with a range of mediums, from personal favorite ink and watercolor illustrations, to handmade/hand bound sketch pads (grimoires), even creating jewelry using human teeth.

vendors.name: Sporophyte
vendors.description: Sporophyte was started by Karen Evans, an SLC native who lived in Brooklyn for 12 years, but now has happily returned to the Great Salt Lake area.  Living in tiny Brooklyn spaces, Karen had trouble nurturing her love of plants, cramming vegetables and fruit trees into much too small pots sitting on precarious balconies. Terrariums were the perfect solution to keep a little piece of nature in a small space.  She is excited about her 2015 line of terrariums, including bell jars, bottles, bowls, and other mostly repurposed shapes.  She is also working on a line of terrarium tools and concrete planters which she will unveil at Craft Lake City 2015.

vendors.name: Chris Bodily
vendors.description: Chris Bodily has been illustrating under the pseudonym Hatrobot for over fifteen years. His work is not about elegance or perfection, it's about honesty. His fluid line work is raw, unpolished, and surreal. Rather than hiding his mistakes, he embraces them. His illustrations are psychological self portraits covered in fingerprints of heartbreak and madness.

vendors.name: Little Teeth Marks
vendors.description: Little Teeth Marks is a funky little shop, inspired by things creepy crawly, cutesy and quirky. LTM specializes in creating one of a kind accessories, art, clothing and more!

vendors.name: Obake Style
vendors.description: Obake (o-bah-kay) is a Japanese word that has come describe nearly all monsters, but it literally translates as changingthing, the shapeshifter. We feel this idea best describes our collective art house label. We shift across artistic mediums. We're fascinated by layers, facades, and hidden truths. We're also heavily influenced by Japanese art and history, from Jōmon to Heisei.

vendors.name: Carrie de Azevedo
vendors.description: I love giving previously used fabrics new form and a new life. I’m turning beautifully colored (but no longer fashionable) wool sweaters into felt, creating jewelry, headbands, bags, and other fun wearables and accessories.

vendors.name: H Works
vendors.description: Silver fever.  Linear.  Minimal.  Handmade love.  This just about sums me up concerning my artistic motivations.  I approach my jewelry with the intention of creating simple designs that are backed by complex ideas.  While the basics are essential - stacking rings and bangles, simple silver posts - the ideas that get me out of bed in the middle of the night, running to my torch and bench, are unconventional designs that challenge the norm.  I want people to wonder, how is that working?  I want observers to be curious, to want a second look.

vendors.name: The Prowess Collective
vendors.description: The Prowess Collective is a Salt Lake city based creative force producing handcrafted leather goods including hooded holsters, cuffs, waist packs, top hats and so much more. No two pieces are alike. We strive to make forward thinking clothing that will last a lifetime.

vendors.name: Vanessa Romo Brekke
vendors.description: Hi my name is Vanessa; In 2012 I graduated with my BFA in Ceramics from the University of Utah. Since graduation I have been pursuing my career in art and growing my small local business.  I am now beginning my MFA at the University of Utah and plan on becoming a professor of art. I was born in Mexico City and my cultural background has been very influential in my work, I am sure you can tell with all the bright colors that I use. I love clay and the endless possibilities this medium provides. I have two bodies of work that explore both functional pottery and sculptural work. There is nothing like handmade products in your home that you can intimately interact with on a daily basis! Thanks for taking a look.

vendors.name: Roscoe and Sage LLC
vendors.description: We make paper bows and bow ties. We have an online store with a Provo-based presence. We also take orders for custom bows which are great for weddings, proms, parties, or any stylish occasion. Handcrafted fashion; handcrafted class.

vendors.name: Silverwear Jewerly SLC
vendors.description: As a child, I loved jewelry, and especially rings. Not just any rings, but the giant, flashy, over the top rings that you can see on someone's finger from twenty feet away. That love of jewelry prompted me to take a metal art/jewelry making class in high school. The teacher challenged the class to create a project using common household items. I coupled that challenge with a piece of my mother's vintage silverware, and made my first spoon ring. That class is where the original inspiration for Silverwear Jewelry SLC began. Fast forward to the present, in addition to refining my metal working skills and learning a lot more about the subtle differences in silverware patterns, I have continued to expand on the original concept, adding; bracelets, earrings, pendants, key chains, wind chimes, vases, hooks, and most recently, a Silverwear Jewelry SLC original, the bicycle rider pendant, to the list of items that I hand make. All of the items mentioned above can be made on site at my booth, using vintage silverplated silverware and basic hand tools consisting of; bolt cutters, files, sandpaper, mandrels, a vise, and a hammer. With an ever changing inventory of over 1000 pieces of silverware (ranging in date from 1800's to 1960's) to choose from, customers can pick a pattern that fits their personality, and watch as I make the piece to their specific size and style in less than 10 minutes. Every piece of jewelry is unique and comes with a DIY demonstration, absolutely free. In addition to the satisfaction I get from creating new and unique pieces of art, I believe that a large part of my success, as well as some of my inspiration can be attributed to the positive feelings people get from being able to choose a specific piece of silverware that they connect with, and then watch as I transform the spoon or fork into a piece of beautiful jewelry. The kind words, positive feedback, friendships made, and overwhelming support that I have received is further inspiration, as well as an affirmation that I am doing exactly what I am supposed to be doing.

vendors.name: Beehive Soap and Body Care
vendors.description: Beehive Soap and Body Care creates lovely handcrafted soaps ...Soap so nice you'll want to lather up twice!  Our pampering continues with amazing solid lotion bars, whipped body butters, lip balms, bath salts, sugar scrubs, creams and bath fizzies!  We are licensed to make U of U and BYU soaps and can easily add your logo/picture to a bar of soap!

vendors.name: ladybug and babybird
vendors.description: ladybug&babybird is handmade knitted and sewn goods for little ones by Stephanie Asay. l&b focuses on unique and custom creations that are sure to be very special to you or whoever you gift them to.
vendors.categories: Children's Items, Knit Items, Sewn Accessories

vendors.name: Hollow Bamboo Pottery
vendors.description: My name is Mark Jones, I'm 21 years old and I am a ceramic artist. There is something remarkable in the act of making unique artwork out of raw earth materials, which alone would be considered little more than just dirt. Using methods we as humans have perfected for thousands of years. I found my personal passion for ceramics about four years ago, in my junior year in high school. Ever since then I have done my best to expand my knowledge, and talents within the craft. I find myself so drawn pottery simply for its versatility, there are endless varieties of techniques and styles of pottery to experiment with that it is virtually impossible to become bored with the subject. This will be my first time putting my work out on the market, and I am extremely excited for the opportunity to do so.

vendors.name: Bykali
vendors.description: Wearable and wall art items are made from leather, resin, wood and found organic and industrial materials. Unconventional items and methods are used to create unique depth and texture.

vendors.name: Stellar Handmade Gear
vendors.description: Stellar: I make bags, wallets, and other fun stuff by hand. The gear is made to be functional, stylish, and built to blast!

vendors.name: Rest 30 Records Omni-Directional Cabs
vendors.description: Rest 30 Records Omni-Directional Cabs has been building, testing, and performing with different models of game-changing omni-directional speaker cabinets and would like to show and tell about the latest models for use in a rock and roll setting. Rest 30 Records Omni-Directional Cabs operates under the believe that the traditional uni-directional speaker cabinet design has been a joke since their invention and proliferation, particularly when paired with omni-directional drumsets, and is passionately trying to provide more appropriate alternatives.

vendors.name: You Doll Design
vendors.description: My name is Laura Miller, was born and raised in SLC, and I'm a visual and graphic artist (and no, I don't design dolls that look like you). My shop name You Doll Design is a play off my maiden name, Udall, which is pronounced the same. I started taking art classes at a young age and continued that passion as recreation into my adulthood. It wasn’t until I was expecting my second child in 2012 however that I took up calligraphy and subsequently decided to make art and hand lettering my business as well as my hobby. I specialize with watercolor but I am comfortable with several types of artistic media (including pencil, calligraphy pen and ink and acrylics) as well as tackling a variety of subject matter. I like to think that my artwork evokes a whimsy that is distinct to my designs while offering an array of styles universal enough to fit well into almost anyone's design aesthetic. I choose subject matter meant to uplift and inspire and hopefully add a little love and beauty to someone's space.

vendors.name: Harmons
vendors.description: Harmons has experienced many changes since our 1932 beginning. One thing that remains unchanged is our commitment to provide quality food for our customers. We love food as much as you do; that's why we spare no effort to give your taste buds the very best. At Harmons, you’re part of the family. Whether online or in person, we are your neighborhood grocer.

vendors.name: Diamond Jane Jewelry
vendors.description: Diamond Jane Jewelry is one of a kind sterling silver and turquoise jewelry handmade by Kiki Jane Sieger.

vendors.name: CM Ceramics
vendors.description: CM Ceramics features the work of artist E Clark Marshall. Many fine dining establishments in the Salt Lake area feature his handmade ceramic plates and bowls, including Forage Restaurant, and Provisions.  In contrast to many potters, his pieces are finished without a ceramic glaze.  The clay is left raw in its natural fired color, and sanded to create a unique texture.  The simple earth colors compliment a wide variety of interior decorum.

vendors.name: Boxbot.net
vendors.description: Dad and I started Boxbot with the intent to bring the illimitable world of 3D printing into the average home. We are also excited to introduce 3D printing into the classroom. Boxbot provides quality 3D printers, filament, and components that will fuel innovation and creativity. We hope to educate future generations as 3D printing makes its way into the fields of science, art, engineering and more.

vendors.name: Thayne Whiting
vendors.description: From boyhood Thayne has aspired to be a peddler. He now peddles his handmade wares of toy sail boats and hand made books. Made from reclaimed materials and fully functional. All from his bike.
vendors.categories: Children's Items, Paper Goods, Printmaking, Repurposed/Upcycled, Retro, Sewn Accessories, Sustainability, Vintage

vendors.name: The Pink Raffy
vendors.description: I make fun accessories for children and Mom's. I adore creating fun items that will create lasting memories.

vendors.name: Beehive Grooming and Co.
vendors.description: Handcrafted men's shaving and grooming products based out of Orem, Utah.

vendors.name: James R Ceramic Artworks
vendors.description: I've been making pottery for over 30 years. I have a Master of Fine Arts degree, and I have taught for over 15 years in higher education. I am currently part of the teaching pool at Ceramic Supply here in SLC, but my focus is making and selling pottery. I create two main styles of pottery. One is more traditional in form, being influenced by medieval German folk pottery. The other style consists of flowing fluid forms that are whimsical, colorful, and fun.

vendors.name: Kagan Byron
vendors.description: Hi I'm Kagan, a collage artist with a playful artistic style characterized by bright, vivid colors, lots of texture and themes inspired largely by nature. I put my heart + soul into everything I do. From creating original illustrations to producing short run studio projects, this is my passion + I'm pleased to share it with you!
vendors.categories: Mixed Media, Paper Goods, Sewn Accessories

vendors.name: Armada Designs
vendors.description: Armada Designs specializes in cross stitch patterns, kits, or custom finished pieces made to order! We embrace the mixing of traditional forms and modern fun designs.

vendors.name: Levi Rogers
vendors.description: Levi Rogers is a writer living in Salt Lake City. He graduated from the University of Utah with a degree in English and is currently getting his MFA from Antioch University in Los Angeles. He writes memoir and creative nonfiction about depression, religion, film, music, and coffee. His writing is dark, hauntingly honest, and sometimes funny. He recently released a chapbook of short stories called A Brief History of Melancholy and is also working on a book about depression and mental illness.

vendors.name: Alexandria Vigil
vendors.description: Accessories and more inspired by Japanese Pop Culture and fashion. From fairy kei to gothic lolita, Aerial Angelic brings Harajuku to you!

vendors.name: HANNAHROSES
vendors.description: HANNAHROSES creates fresh lasrcut jewelry that is unique, completely customizable and affordable! My jewelry allows me to combine my profession as a Graphic Designer with my passion for on point accessories. Each piece is hand designed in the computer, laser cut, and hand assembled with love. With the addition of my new HRLuxe line, I now offer new luxury pieces cut from metal and plated with 24k gold and Sterling Silver. I specialize in completely customizable gold and silver bar necklaces, available for purchase on my Big Cartel shop!

vendors.name: Collectivity Lane
vendors.description: Collectivity Lane is a graphic design studio based in the beautiful city of Kaysville, UT. It was founded in 2013 by Kelsie Monsen to share her love of elegant yet simple design with you!

vendors.name: Squid Vishuss
vendors.description: An urban mermaid from the ocean on the moon. Inspired by fantasy, kitsch, vintage, urban elements, pinup art and fashion. Loves to incorporate a touch of whimsy and  macabre to feminine and ethereal surroundings. Often includes nautical themes and retro toys. Self taught and works in different mediums including, watercolor, gouache, embroidery, and photography.

vendors.name: Sprinkle and Dash
vendors.description: Sprinkle & Dash is the the baby of a four month stint in a Parisian patisserie, two years of culinary school, and a lifelong baking obsession. I found that my favorite thing about baking is that I get to make people *really* happy through treats. Known for our mini pies and jumbo cookies we bring delicious, artisan treats to Salt Lake Locals.

vendors.name: CRUDE Personal Care
vendors.description: CRUDE is an all-natural skincare line that nourishes, supplements, and supports your skin's natural defensive and regenerative processes. CRUDE only uses pure, simple, botanical ingredients that don't strip, strain, or stress the skin, but work to clean, moisturize, and heal your body's biggest organ. LOVE YOUR SKIN. LIVE CRUDE.

vendors.name: Wonderland Vintage
vendors.description: We are collectors of things we love from the past. I am fascinated with Globes, Maps, Vintage Kitchen Tins, Cake Tins, kitchen gadgets, embroidered dish towels. We also combine our love for industrial finds and barn wood and create furniture. Also we create barn-wood arrows,hearts and letters that are illuminated with lights.

vendors.name: Argentinas Best Empanadas SLC
vendors.description: Enjoy the best handcrafted Argentine empanadas in the Salt Lake Valley. We pride ourselves by offering six varieties of homemade style empanadas filled with locally sourced produce, grass fed beef and lamb all year long.  Argentina's Best Empanadas guarantees freshness and quality empanadas made to order.

vendors.name: BAN Supply Collaboration
vendors.description: Bree and Nate Millard studied at the University of Utah, where they both received bachelors degrees. They are contributing photographers at Brighton Resort under the alias of Brigtown Chronicles. They also collaborate, under the name Ban Supply Co, in wood cut pieces. The “wood cut poster art” as they call it started when they began to experiment with old photographs and woodcutting. They began collaborating three years ago and have further developed their concepts. They like to keep the subject matter light and fun. Both are avid mountain bikers, snowboarders and skateboarders, also influenced by art and midcentury design. Their hope is further explore these interests and integrate them into their wood cuts and designs. They work as a team on the design and layout. Nate illustrates everything by hand and Bree does the wood cutting. They specialize in vintage pieces. They make various signage, poster art, custom pieces and small furniture. They established a working relationship with Uinta Brewing to reproduce their beer labels in Ban's wood cut style, as well as design the seasonal Brighton IPA logo. Bree and Nate are always looking for opportunities to challenge their wood cut designs and abilities. It is important to them as lovers of the outdoors and arts to keep their work interesting, inspiring and uplifting.

vendors.name: Lars Love Letters
vendors.description: Lars Love Letters is a handmade paper studio, a print making playground and experimental pulp laboratory. Brady Lars and Meghan Burrows make small batch hand made papers in their home studio. They illustrate, press pulp, pulls screen prints, crank letterpresses and couch paper posts. They have a line of slightly off humor cards, spacey posters and other one of kind paper based goods. LLL's makes all their own papers from recycled papers stocks and junk mail. Spreading the love without creating new waste.

vendors.name: Laura Frisk Art
vendors.description: Hi, I'm Laura! I make hand woodblock printed animal pillows and other home decor inspired by animals and the outdoors. Each design is an original drawing on wood, which I hand carve out, then ink up and press into fabric, like a stamp. In enjoy making everything from scratch and being involved in each step of my process.

vendors.name: Vintage Fern
vendors.description: In my work, I love to use new, vintage, repurposed, and upcycled fabrics and materials.  I love to mix color and patterns in unexpected ways, I think it makes my products fun and unique.  A lot of my things are one of a kind.  A lot of my items are sewn, but I don’t limit myself to just sewing, I love learning and using all kinds of art and craft mediums.  I make everything myself using a vintage sewing machine that has a permanent spot in my living room.  I get inspiration from my three girls, nature, vintage finds, really just about everywhere.  I love creating beautiful and useful things, it makes me happy.

vendors.name: Dallin Orr Art
vendors.description: Dallin Orr is a local artist and illustrator.  He is currently working on his Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in illustration at Utah Valley University.  He was born and raised in the Salt Lake Valley and is an avid reader, hiker, and creator.

vendors.name: Old News Records
vendors.description: Old News Records is a DIY publishing company and record label specializing in Salt Lake City-based artists. We've produced novels, comics, zines, records, t-shirts, buttons and crafts in all genres over the course of our nearly decade-long existence.

vendors.name: Catherine Marchant
vendors.description: Catherine Marchant began working with fiber at age 9, when she learned to knit.  She began spinning in 1984 and weaving a year later. Somewhere along the way a weaving friend introduced her to the world of bead weaving and she acquired another addictive pastime. She loves to use bright colors and include glittery threads and beads. I want the people wearing my creations to stand out.

vendors.name: Grow Home Artistry
vendors.description: Grow Home Artistry is a creative workspace based in Salt Lake City, owned and founded by DIY artist Nick Jones. I am an artist and musician, with an education in sociology. I paint, illustrate, build, screen print, write, take photos, and make music.  Grow Home Artistry operates a professional screen printing press. We produce our own clothing line called Surmise Clothing, as well as custom orders for local artisans.  We choose screen printing as a way to place art on materials with utilitarian uses like shirts, bags, hats, aprons, posters, patches and jackets. Grow Home Artistry was founded to create, share, and collaborate. We are dedicated to sharing a DIY ethic while working to integrate life and art. We strive to inspire, empower, and enchant one another to create a stronger, more active and connected community and to inspire social change from the ground up.

vendors.name: Christina Williams
vendors.description: Hi! I'm Christina. I grew up in the back rooms of my parents' office and art supply store in South/Central Utah. I began my design career at the age of five, with a short-lived, very exclusive line of paper handbags that sold for a nickel each. Several decades later, I'm still making and selling paper goods. I love exploring color and pattern while making useful, high-quality products. My items are a combination of hand-drawn patterns and lettering along with my original digital designs. I'm so excited to be a part of Craft Lake City this year. Stop in and say hi! If you ask really nicely, I may be able to whip together a paper handbag for you. ;)

vendors.name: PicoCluster LLC
vendors.description: PicoCluster is an educational and business tool designed to teach and train the next generation of computing professionals. They are the ones that will be solving our future business and societal problems. A PicoCluster consists of hardware and software designed to easily learn parallel and distributed computing concepts and programming. Think of the systems that Google, Facebook, and Google use. It mimics that same kind of computing environment, just in a very small, inexpensive, and power efficient way. It comes packaged with software to help manage the PicoCluster and the software running on it. The PicoCluster comes with an app store that makes it easy to select and install the software you want to learn. It also comes with a large selection of training courses, making this a complete learning tool.

vendors.name: christina aletto
vendors.description: My mother tells me stories of the assorted items she would find under my pillow when I was a child. I guess I have always found beauty in the everyday items and the items that someone else thought was garbage. I find it challenging and incredibly rewarding to be finding new uses for items that were once headed to the landfill.  Using scraps is like a jigsaw puzzle, and it is great fun to see what the end result will be.  All items are one of a kind!

vendors.name: Mushaboom knits
vendors.description: I'm Heather Stevens, the artist behind mushaboom knits, a vintage inspired toy and clothing line for modern kids. I've been knitting for over a decade, but it wasn't until I had my daughter that I developed a passion for it. I wanted to be able to create animals she could invite to back yard tea parties, and clothing she could wear on her most exciting adventures. I still create with these goals in mind. I hope every whimsical item becomes a best friend or family heirloom.

vendors.name: Wildfield Paper Co.
vendors.description: Wildfield Paper Co. is a one of a kind paper goods company based out of Salt Lake City, UT. Heavily inspired by nature and diverse cultures Annie Mertlich carefully handcrafts each painting creating Wildfield's unique look! All products are printed locally on recycled heavy weight card stock.

vendors.name: Zions Den Apparel
vendors.description: Zions Den Apparel is a Handmade Clothing company made in the mountains of Park City, Utah. Home to the Mountain Mama TM apparel line as well! We offer leggings, beanies, headwraps, yoga wear, and screen printed items for all ages and sizes!

vendors.name: Wildflower Goods
vendors.description: Wildflower Goods uses reclaimed wood and creative cabinet/drawer knobs to create a unique piece of art to display your necklaces on your wall. Makes for a beautiful piece in your home and creates an ease for finding and displaying your timeless treasures.

vendors.name: Veronica Perez
vendors.description: Veronica is a Chicana artist that draws on her experiences, identity and ancestry as forms of strength and creativity. Her work employs a keen command of color to portray historical images and a unique brand of iconography rooted in her own Mexican and Indigenous culture. When she is not painting, Veronica is creating modern renditions of traditional folk art and one-of-a-kind jewelry pieces.

vendors.name: Pictureline
vendors.description: Pictureline opened in Salt Lake City in February 1989 as a small one-man operation dedicated to providing exemplary service to all who crossed its threshold. Twenty six years and twenty employees later, that credo of exemplary service remains - not only to those visiting the store, but also to guests on the web. This local photography and video equipment service provides education by knowledgable and experienced professionals who will guide you to create your best imaging. They provide honest and personal service with courtesy as if it were still a one-man shop. Every product that comes through the store is carefully chosen by its guaranteed quality.  Pictureline employees stand by their ambition to make your experience meet or exceed your expectations.

vendors.name: anne b designs
