vendors.description: anne b designs is based in Salt Lake City, Utah (USA) and was founded by Sarah Burroughs. She is a self-taught designer and finally left the corporate world last year to pursue her passion for design and handmade goods. All anne b's products are handpicked, handcut, and handmade using a mix of bold textiles and fine leathers to give you statement pieces to compliment your lifestyle. A selection of products pull influence from Sarah’s travels to Uganda and India where she and a team of makers taught sewing to women in slum communities. anne b stands by innovation and education by offering employment to local refugees and providing beginning and intermediate sewing workshops to the community.

vendors.name: Heidi Kidd Jewelry
vendors.description: HEIDI KIDD JEWELRY Each piece of my jewelry is handmade and one of a kind. My work has been influenced by the simple forms of nature that inhabit the coast line of Southern California and the mountains of Utah. Using natural gem stones, sterling silver and goldfilled materials, I create pieces that are meant to compliment the person who wears them.

vendors.name: Alexi Bullock Design, LLC
vendors.description: An Instagram junkie, master party-thrower, and IKEA supporter, Alexi Bullock is hugely obsessed and wildly smitten with graphic design, branding and identity work. Through her freelance design studio—Alexi Bullock Design, LLC—Alexi specializes in branding and identity work, along with a wide spectrum of other services, such as: web design, blog design, app design, hand-lettering, wedding invitations, and more. Her skills in graphic design combined with DIY projects, party planning, and interior design create an inspirational and creative blog about her personal life and various projects. Alexi is also a founder and author of Our Fashion MAP where she blogs with her sister about fashion, beauty, and travel. When Alexi is not designing or blogging, she spends time with her husband of almost 5 years watching Shark Tank, hiking, or taking road trips. Alexi’s ultimate goal is to inspire others with uniquely smart and pleasing projects so those individuals are empowered to help change the world. Alexi has crafted hand-lettered posters, modern tea towels, and mousepads that are sold at her store and will be available at Craft Lake city 2015.
vendors.categories: Painting, Paper Goods, Printmaking, Sewn Accessories, Textile

vendors.name: Allison Cornu Studios
vendors.description: Hello! I am a graphic designer, trained print maker and a lover of beautiful paper goods! I have been making fine stationary and wedding invitations in the mountains of Salt Lake City, Utah on a 1956 flatbed press for about 3 years with husband and great dog, Harry. Everything is hand printed and designed by me  (unless otherwise stated.)

vendors.name: Taveen Jewelry
vendors.description: Taveen is hand-crafted sterling silver jewelry inspired by an eclectic collection of interests by Sarena Boyd.

vendors.name: Zaniac
vendors.description: Zaniac makes math, technology, and other STEM fields of study fun, helping K-8 kids to become engaged, develop confidence, and measurably improve their academic performance. Zaniac is like school at its best—an active, inspiring place filled with friends and friends-to-be. For more information about our Utah locations in Sugar House and Park City, visit www.zaniaclearning.com.
vendors.categories: DIY Engineer, Electronics, Engineering, Science, Technology

vendors.name: USU Extension 4-H
vendors.description: USU Extension 4-H is Making a Difference through 3-D printing, rockets, robots, garden hacks and more! Utah 4-H is a proactive part of the maker movement. Utah 4-H teaches youth leadership, citizenship, and life skills using a learn by doing approach and is an educational program that provides wholesome, fun activities for youth. 4-H is a nationwide program offered locally through your Utah State University Extension office and is the youth development program of our nation's Cooperative Extension System & USDA.

vendors.name: Desire
vendors.description: We combine classic techniques with modern flavors to create desserts worthy of Desire.

vendors.name: LeggyBlondeShop
vendors.description: Mom of 3 taking out my frustrations through a creative outlet. I discovered I enjoy painting peg dolls, after years of being a doodler, the peg painting is a fun new change. I enjoy the challenge of custom orders and have made some characters I've never heard of! I've recently discovered my love of plants and began creating fun planters for succulents and air plants.

vendors.name: Peck's Vanilla
vendors.description: We're a husband and wife team who started making vanilla extract for family and friends. We quickly fell in love with all things vanilla and have been slowly expanding to different strengths of extract, three types of sugars, as well as vanilla paste. We make everything from scratch and in small hand crafted batches. You'd think the secret ingredient is love, and you'd be right. But mostly it's vanilla.

vendors.name: Patric Bates
vendors.description: Patric Bates has been painting and drawing his whole life. Art is life.

vendors.name: SLCDogus
vendors.description: SLCDogus produces handmade goodness for our canine companions. Colorful, stylish leashes and toys made from durable recycled and retired climbing rope are sure to grab attention at the dog park and on the trail. Our wholesome and delicious treat recipes have strength in their simplicity, because we understand how important it is to know exactly what goes into our dogs' bellies. We love our dogs, your dogs, all dogs!

vendors.name: 58bluebirds
vendors.description: 58bluebirds is a curated collection of vintage clothing and accessories, baby wears and home goods. We specialize in fashion forward, trend following and pristine condition vintage items. Find us on Etsy or by appointment in Salt Lake City. Owner Sonja Blackham is a fashion stylist and designer, wardrobe consultant, window designer, and retail specialist.

vendors.name: Maeberry Vintage LLC
vendors.description: Founder of Maeberry Vintage Clothing Store located at 215 East Broadway in the heart of Salt Lake City, UT. I wore my first vintage dress at the age of 6.  I have been in love with vintage ever since.  Wearing something as unique as you are was satisfying at a young age and continues to be today.  Sharing this love with others is my dream job. I stated selling vintage clothing on Etsy in 2010 and opened a retail store in SLC in 2013. Maeberry Vintage is a cornucopia of vintage clothing and accessories.  Our store is filled with vintage treasures from the 1920's to the 1990's. Vintage clothing is one-of-a-kind just like you. We BUY, SELL, + TRADE vintage clothing. Find something that fits you inside and out at Maeberry Vintage.
vendors.categories: Antiques, Clothing, Handbags, Jewelry, Retro, Vintage

vendors.name: Vinylicious Designs
vendors.description: These colorful products are hand cut and sewn out of high quality upholstery vinyl that is durable and easy to clean. I love to create products that are useful such as a handbag, a notebook, or even a baby bib and then make them fun to use by creating great designs and using bold and pleasing colors.  I hope in the end I have designed a product that will add joy to someone's day as they use it and inspire him or her in some way. As a mother of 5 children I purposely created a business that I could do from home that allows me to express myself creatively.  I love that in turn I have taught my children the joy of creativity and inspired them to be entrepreneurs as well.

vendors.name: Candi's Tie Dye
vendors.description: Candida Duran is a 23 year old filmmaker from Salt Lake City, UT. Last year was her first year participating in the DIY festival and she's back for more! Every item dyed is upcycled from second-hand stores of the Salt Lake City area. What better way to reuse unwanted clothes than to tie dye it?

vendors.name: Scatterbrain Tees and Ties
vendors.description: I create original artwork and screen print it on shirts, neckties and more. My images are sometimes surreal, usually detailed and always unique. They range from dapper foxes to musical apocalypses to Dr. Seuss-styled Abe Lincolns. I've had items for sale in the Museum of Modern Art in New York and Japan, on ThinkGeek.com and many other places around the world and on the net.

vendors.name: Kat Martin
vendors.description: I take old abandoned landscapes and paint in something funny, creepy, geeky or cool! My main focus is on pop culture and the smile inducing mash ups of fresh trendy subjects onto otherwise forgotten landscape art. I also enjoy altering figurines into zombies, skeletons and the like.

vendors.name: just-iced cookies
vendors.description: I have been baking sugar cookies for as long as I can remember.  While living in Texas a few years back, I took a cake decorating class and discovered that I could use similar decorating techniques on my cookies.  I have always been somewhat of an artist, dabbling in pencil, watercolor, and oils - and this new edible art medium became an exciting hobby.  I started blogging about my creations, and sharing them at my kids birthday parties…when people started to say, “You should sell these!” I opened an Etsy shop in 2010, which is still currently in operation, and continue to have a steady stream of orders as well as return customers.  I have provided cookies for birthday parties, weddings, bridal showers, baby showers, school auctions, fundraisers, in addition to gifts and seasonal items.  I have also taught basic cookie decorating to small groups.  I have received praise for my cookies, not only for their appearance but also their taste. I moved to Salt Lake City from the Philadelphia area in the summer of 2014.  I would love to share my cookies on a more local level, as well as teach decorating classes.  I love the arts and crafts scene here, I believe that participating in local art shows and boutiques will help me achieve this goal.

vendors.name: Brain Awareness - University of Utah Neuroscience Initiative
vendors.description: Brain Awareness from the University of Utah Neuroscience Initiative is all about brain research, safety, and health. Visit us for neuro-themed crafts, activities, and to learn about the brain, how it works, and why keeping it active is so important!

vendors.name: Vive Juicery
vendors.description: An organic cold-pressed juice company, fueled by love and local farms. It's about getting a day's worth of fruits and veggies in a single glass. Also, there's dance parties, doorstep delivery & major feel good vibes.

vendors.name: Esther Longmore, LLC
vendors.description: Esther Longmore is a graphic and surface pattern designer based in Salt Lake. Though she spent some of her formative years among the lakes and woods of Minnesota and western towns of Wyoming, she has spent the majority of her life nestled in the Rocky Mountains of Utah. Her interest in design started when Esther’s sister taught her the colors of the rainbow using a plush toy. As a child, she decorated common objects to make them pretty and give to friends and family. She remembers warm afternoons sprawled out on the grass and sidewalks coloring with friends. From back-of-the-math-test drawings, Esther graduated to studying graphic design in college. Sweet on the surface; silly, quirky, and sassy on the inside, her work reflects that personality. She adores all things springtime, which shows in her work through subject and color. Esther’s ambition is to add delight to your day and home by Making ordinary things pretty.™ In addition to running an online stationery shop, Esther is cutting her teeth in art licensing. Her first licensed patterns are exclusively available from Shibumi Home. She plans to expand further into art licensing, decorating as many surfaces as her heart can dream of.

vendors.name: God Hates Robots
vendors.description: God Hates Robots became reality in 2015 after countless thoughts, efforts, hopes and plans had either fallen through or were pushed back for other priorities. Our world is temporary and this effort to create something positive, inherently local and somewhat left-field is now very important. God Hates Robots is an effort to promote art and sell artwork. This effort is not unique to the concept of a gallery. Our approach, however, differentiates us from our peers.

vendors.name: Hillzart
vendors.description: Hillzart specializes in wood work, specifically pyrography, jewelry making, skateboards, lamps, and wooden pottery. Creating unique and colorful art pieces that you can wear, skate, or display!

vendors.name: Queen Farina
vendors.description: Our two families are joined by sisters with a crazy love for fresh, whole foods, sunshine and beekeeping.  We come from a long line of Italians that love to cook and eat.  We live in the kitchen and start cooking the next meal before we've finished the last.  If you have a love for food and eating like we do, then you've come to the right place!  Our honey is raw, natural, and delicious.  You've come here to partake...welcome to the family!

vendors.name: Cut n' Cuffed
vendors.description: A variety of hand-made items including hand sewn, stitched, and tooled custom leather wallets, unique prints, & painted wooden boxes.

vendors.name: Natalee Cooper
vendors.description: I am an illustrator, hand letterer, designer and a semi professional taco taster.  I love all things creative and am happiest when I get to share it with others.

vendors.name: The Felt Shop
vendors.description: We are moms who hand make childrens felt items for imaginary and interactive play. We make felt busy books, DIY crafts kits for kids to craft with their parents and small to-go activities that fit neatly inside an Altoid tin.  We began this for the benefit of our kids and now hope to share that love to create and craft with other families who need some time away from the screen.

vendors.name: The Bees Knees Shoppe
vendors.description: I am the felt girl! I make various banners and garlands cut from sheets of wool blend felt that I stiffen with glue and water. I opened my business on Etsy.com in May 2014, but enjoy doing craft shows just as much!

vendors.name: Kindred OAK LLC
vendors.description: Kindred OAK is the place to find one-of-a-kind items for hip mommas and their babes. Here you'll find unique, comfortable clothing and accessories influenced by today's best trends and a classic, timeless look. Here, comfort meets fashion.....Because it’s not just about what you’re wearing – it’s about how you feel when you’re wearing it.  - Designer, Paige Smith

vendors.name: House Of Tenebris
vendors.description: House Of Tenebris is a husband and wife team with a penchant for all things mystical, creating pieces to adorn you. We work primarily in copper, brass, bronze and gemstones. All of our work is handfabricated by us in our studio in Salt Lake City.

vendors.name: Sabrina Squires
vendors.description: Ancient civilizations mastered the technique of representing their lives two-dimensionally, as evidenced in their cave paintings and relief sculptures.  While recognizably capturing the goings-on of their societies, they began the tradition of abstraction, where an object is formally defined.  When viewed, these artifacts possess a curious ambiguity due to the removal of context created by the passage of time.  I use representational figures in the same way:  as vehicles through which to study color and line while referencing the world they depict.  I begin with a sanded layer of National Geographic pages that lay a foundation rich with texture and subdued colors.  Next, I build a framework of geometric and organic line that both organizes the texture and provides a skeletal structure to support the culminating coat.  Washes of acrylic paint build to produce a matrix of collaborating colors, while the varying transparency ties all three layers together in contrasting depth.

vendors.name: Morgaine Fehlauer
vendors.description: I'm currently a senior finishing a BFA in printmaking and a BS in analytic philosophy at the University of Utah. I generally focus on themes of personal identity, body image, and perception. In my work I document the relationships people have with their bodies through portraits rendered using varied printmaking techniques. I work directly with people I know and each print is dictated by that person's narrative regarding their own relationship with their body. Through this intimate interaction I am able to be the conduit for them to process their lived experience and share it with others.

vendors.name: Velo City Bags
vendors.description: Velo City Bags was started by me, Nathan Larsen, after I couldn't find my ideal messenger bag and set out to make my own. The bag needed to be rugged to survive Utah's harsh winters, comfortable enough to wear around town, have a clean, modern design and be made without dubious labor practices. After many long nights of researching, sewing and experimenting Velo City Bags was born in 2008. I make the designs, cut out the patterns, and saw every bag by hand. Made vegan, by vegans.

vendors.name: brooklyn ottens
vendors.description: My art is inspired by nature, geometry, illusions, lettering, patterns, repetition, and multi cultural symbolism.  I look to express something beyond the black and white elements of life to view shades of gray never before seen and to learn to read between the lines. Life can be illusive until you are able to see that it's an illusion.

vendors.name: ANGLE
vendors.description: ANGLE’s fine jewelry is edgy and unique, yet simple and comfortable. The carefully made, long-lasting quality is affordable and great for every-day wear, no matter the occasion. It can be difficult to find simplistic and comfortable jewelry that still makes an impression and accentuates your style – but ANGLE does just that. Each piece is delicately hand-sawed, fired, sanded and polished individually. ANGLE is quirky and unique just like you are. Live Your ANGLE.

vendors.name: Wasatch Beekeepers Association
vendors.description: We are a non-profit organization dedicated to the promotion of beekeeping.   We are beekeepers that are learning more and more each season to promote the health of the local honey bees. Teaching the public about the importance of the honey bee is one of our goals.

vendors.name: Daley's A Men's Shop
vendors.description: Daley's has a wide range of men's new and vintage clothing. Our new men's apparel brands consist of: Dr. Martens, Levi's, Original Penguin, Handsome Me and many more. Our vintage clothing selection varies but each item of clothing is hand selected outside of the state of Utah to ensure that our inventory consists of classic styles not found elsewhere. You can expect the best quality vintage clothing here at Daley's A Men's Shop.

vendors.name: Denik
vendors.description: The Denik brand began with a few college guys at Utah State University, and has blossomed from a grassroots street team of book-slingers to a grassroots, artsy-ecletic bunch. Now slinging books to customers, corporations, and clients across the globe. We believe that the art of a high-schooler in Houston, or a professional artist in Brazil can be printed on one of our books and be used to impact generations. We've been featured on The New York Times, MTV.com, The Huffington Post, Good Morning America Live, TOMS Marketplace, Glamour Magazine, Nordstrom, and Salt Lake Magazine.

vendors.name: Granite Fox
vendors.description: I specialize in wire-wrapped gemstone jewelry. Each piece is unique and hand-crafted. I use a variety of crystals and gems including Quartz, pyrite, amethyst, turquoise, and Druzy stones. I also create beaded jewelry as well.

vendors.name: Asana Natural Arts
vendors.description: Real butterfly wings and nature items used after living a full life are crafted into a variety of unique jewelry and home decor items. Butterfly wings are hand cut and preserved in jeweler's grade resin. Other nature items include beetle wings, porcupine quills, 4-leaf clovers, and seashells. Information cards are included to learn more about each species and preservation farms.

vendors.name: Green Stitches
vendors.description: I have never really considered myself an artist but I love to create. I am a stay at home mom and work to create safe natural toys for children to enjoy for a lifetime.

vendors.name: PEEQ
vendors.description: DIY is in my DNA. My father always taught me the value of doing something yourself and taking pride in your workmanship.  A philosophy that I've carried throughout my personal life and professional career.  I mean, what's the worst that can happen? Like Edison said, you figure out another way not to do it.  As an entrepreneur I've done everything from building a freestanding forty foot communications tower out of a pile of angle iron, to creating a throw-able wireless microphone for audience participation. What I love about Makers and DIY'ers is that instead of wishing someone would make that one thing that would make our lives easier in some way, we get our hands dirty and make it ourselves!

vendors.name: The Hand Drawn Photo Booth
vendors.description: Natalie is the sole operator and inventor of The Hand Drawn Photo Booth. She has been in operation since 2011. Come get your portrait drawn in the style of a photo booth! Get 4 poses quickly drawn of your likeness.
vendors.categories: Graffiti/Street Art, Mixed Media, Paper Goods, Photography

vendors.name: The Sailor's Song
vendors.description: The Sailor's Song is a Stationery Company. Our products include art prints, greeting cards, journals, and home decor items.

vendors.name: Salt Lake City Corporation
vendors.description: Salt Lake City is proud to be a Signature Event Fund sponsor of the 2015 Craft Lake City DIY Festival. Signature events are a big part of making Salt Lake City one of the best places in the country for residents and visitors to live, work and play. The City is thrilled to be part of this year’s event and will be hosting a booth at the Craft Lake City DIY Festival with the Salt Lake City Main Public Library, YouthCity and the Sorenson Unity Center to provide information about City STEM-related programs, events and public engagement opportunities. We hope to see you there!
vendors.categories: Electronics, Engineering, Technology, Teen Vendor 12 - 17 Years Old (Requires Parental Supervision), Kid

vendors.name: Ellens Custom Quilting
vendors.description: I have sewing and quilting experience for 45 years; have had my quilting business for 20 years specializing in very custom quilts of all kinds:  memory, t-shirt, temple, memory, etc. I specialize in creating quilts from an idea--from my years of sewing, quilting, and tailoring I can come up with anything that anyone can imagine.
vendors.categories: Clothing, Handbags, Repurposed/Upcycled, Retro, Sewn Accessories

vendors.name: Nicole Choules
vendors.description: Hello my name is Nicole & I am the owner/designer of Hum, formerly know as Elsa Bags. I make little girl dresses & toddler shirts as well as leather bags & leather bracelets.

vendors.name: Salty Bison
vendors.description: Salty Bison is a handmade and hand painted sign company. We build our signs from new and reclaimed wood. We design and laser cut wood as well.

vendors.name: Wildbird
vendors.description: Stylish slings for modern mamas. We are simplifying and beautifying motherhood.

vendors.name: PatternJam
vendors.description: PatternJam is a web-application for quilting and sewing enthusiasts!  PatternJam enables the user to create a quilt or select a designer pattern and audition fabric in that pattern.  In other words, PatternJam provides the tools to preview what a sewing project will look like before investing time and money in the project~ and it's FREE to use!

vendors.name: Black Rabbit Arts
vendors.description: My name Is Katrina Flores and I am a twenty one year old artist living in the Salt Lake valley with my artist husband.  I have spent the last three years at Salt Lake Community College and have earned an Associated Degree in Graphic Design and another Associates in Illustration. Next to my husband and my dog Art is one of the loves of my life and I love to share my work with other like minded people. I surround myself with art and artistic people because I love living my life surrounded by beautiful things and people. I don't believe that an individual can truly live their lives to the fullest unless they have opened their souls to the blessings of art.

vendors.name: Mae Woven
vendors.description: Wife, mom of two, project enthusiast turning beautiful authentic African mudcloth fabric into home goods and weaving woven wall hangings like a true flower child.
vendors.categories: DIY Engineer, Housewares, Knit Items, Textile

vendors.name: Little Sapling Toys
vendors.description: Since its beginning in 2008, Little Sapling Toys has grown to be the largest toy seller on Etsy and is carried in retail shops around the country. This family business designs modern wooden toys and crafts them with the highest quality materials in their Huntsville, UT wood shop. They have always believed in innovative toys and a healthy earth and plant a tree for each toy sold. Little Sapling Toys brought life to the classic wooden teether by offering the widest selection of shapes available. They have designed and produced a solid selection of organic developmental toys and blocks. Buying toys became even more special with the option to personalize them with a laser engraver. Now, there are more than just toys for children, with a wide selection of baby's first ornaments, growth charts, and modern step stools. Little Sapling Toys has been featured in publications such as Country Living, InStyle, Pregnancy & Newborn, Mothering, Dwell.com and Forbes.com.

vendors.name: Retro Betty
vendors.description: Retro Betty is a locally owned vintage inspired boutique located in the heart of East Milcreek Salt Lake City.  Established in 2012, we offer a unique mix of old and new that is sure to bring you back to the good ole days. From retro inspired reproduction clothing to actual vintage one of a kind pieces, you are sure to find something unique you will love!  We support and sell local artists' merchandise and offer many made in the USA items.  Vintage typewriters, funny novelty socks, new candy cigarettes, men's bowling shirts to vintage kitchen gadgets, we offer something for everyone.  Stop by our brick and mortar shop at 2300 East 2821 South in Salt Lake City.
vendors.categories: Antiques, Clothing, Handbags, Housewares, Jewelry, Repurposed/Upcycled, Retro, Vintage

vendors.name: Randy Laub Photography
vendors.description: I work in the photography field and also work in the travel industry and have done so for many years. Due to travel industry work, I have been invited numerous times to travel events held in Italy and Germany. Going to Italy, Germany and other European countries many times took my photography interest to these locales in particular. Wandering narrow European streets, for example, I attempt to capture a unique perspective and document the beauty in things that most people walk by and don't really notice. I was born and currently live in Salt Lake City. I have also lived in Reno, Nevada, northern Utah, and Germany.

vendors.name: Winterrose Woodworking
vendors.description: Brad learned woodcraft from his Grandfather. Grandpa Ab and Brad have been building and selling toys for over 20 years together. Ab has since passed. However, Brad has restored his grandfather's wood shop and is carrying on his legacy creating toys and furniture. Everything is handmade in Heber City by Brad and his wife Natasha.

vendors.name: The Green Urban Lunchbox
vendors.description: The Green Urban Lunchbox revitalizes neglected space to provide food for our community. We work to help people of all incomes have access to healthy food, using resources available in their communities.

vendors.name: Sage & Ember
vendors.description: Sage and Ember, based in Salt Lake City, was brought about by a desire to meld old techniques with modern ideas. By employing a minimal ideology, and our fair share of geometric shapes, we strive to create cutting edge and timeless art for your home.
vendors.categories: Children's Items, Knit Items, Sewn Accessories, Textile

vendors.name: Stitched Cards
vendors.description: Jeni Shirley specializes in embroidered greeting cards and gifts - each a meticulously handcrafted tactile way of connecting with someone special. Jeni also custom prints and reps some of her favorite talented artists. Make it personal with Stitched Cards.

vendors.name: Blue Copper Roasters
vendors.description: We roast coffees of exceptional quality and serve them cold-brewed or hot. Find us at our brick n' mortar at 179 west 900 south!

vendors.name: Planned Parenthood Association of Utah
vendors.description: Planned Parenthood Association of Utah is committed to providing accurate information to individuals of all ages concerning the emotional and physical aspects of human sexual behavior and reproduction; providing affordable, high quality reproductive health care services; and protecting and advocating for the rights of individuals to understand and manage their own reproductive lives.

vendors.name: Aller Apparel
vendors.description: Aller Apparel is for the doers, the dreamers, the creators, the motivators, over-achievers, the risk takers. I hope to inspire you to GO DO. GO follow your dreams, influence those around you to be great, and DO what you love above all else. GO DO.

vendors.name: Sunzeecar
vendors.description: The Sunzeecar Corporation was Founded at the turn of the millennium by Dr. Andy Schoenberg, a research professor from the U of U in an effort to ease our impact on the planet for our transportation needs. Beginning with electrically-assisted Human Powered Vehicles, his annual models have evolved from two to three wheels and also from human pedaling power to un-assisted solar power. The most recent model can accelerate to fifty miles an hour! (No pedaling needed...at all!

vendors.name: Sugared Caramel Candy
vendors.description: Providing small moments of joy to everyone!  We feature naturally sugar-free & vegan caramel candy, along with 10 other more traditional flavors, caramel sauce in three flavors, caramel popcorn, coffee stir spoons and everything else caramel!

vendors.name: Ker-ij Jewelry
vendors.description: Ker-ij Jewelry was created in 2011 by Stacey Jo Rabiger, a Salt Lake City native obsessed with rocks, crystals and other natural elements. Inspired by the individual meanings and properties thought to coincide with each stone, Stacey Jo creates unique hand crafted jewelry with intention and meaning to heal, adorn. Design that is raw, organic chic and purposed.

vendors.name: Old News Co.
vendors.description: Operated by the super cheesy couple Kimi and Roxy, Old News makes t-shirts and accessories that put a fun, hipster spin on our nation's history. To boot, its products are made in the USA and hand-printed by the aforementioned cheesy couple.

vendors.name: VI*VA
vendors.description: Vi*Va is Adrian Villaneuva ( Local Seamtress and Designer ) and Charles Vasquez ( Local Screen Printer and Illustrator ) together create hand bags and side bags using repurposed upcycled material. We bring a style durived from our native roots.

vendors.name: The Wooden Word
vendors.description: I am a Collector, not a hoarder.  I've worked in bookstores for over 15 years, specializing in children's books.  I independently sell paper treasures that cannot fit into my personal collection: antique books, illustrated fancies (ephemera), literature, comic books, and prints.  I salvage pages and prints from books that are worse than beat-up and torn-apart.  I do not condone ripping up perfectly good reading books.  Buy Local First!
vendors.categories: Antiques, Children's Items, Paper Goods, Repurposed/Upcycled, Vintage, Wood/Metal

vendors.name: Paper Bandit Press
vendors.description: We are Paper Bandit Press, a husband and wife team.  We have our own line of unique cards and posters that we wholesale and retail as well as doing custom work.  We print on two vintage printing presses named Norman and Bandit.  We love everything about what we do and the people we work with.  There is nothing like letterpress.

vendors.name: Garwood Beverage, LLC
vendors.description: We are a brand new addition to the ever expanding universe of locally produced premium food products in Salt Lake City. Our primary goal is to bring Salt Lake City its greatest ginger beer yet. Garwood's Ginger Beer is a fantastic cocktail of cold-pressed juices, providing unparalleled freshness in an invigorating soft drink. We are just getting started wholesaling and we look forward to an exciting first year in business. We can't wait to meet you and give you a taste of our awesome drink!

vendors.name: Butcher's Bunches Handcrafted Preserves
vendors.description: Deliciously Jamalicious, no sugar added fruit spreads, handcrafted right here in Utah!  Get your Jam on and try the taste of real fresh fruit in a jar -it's the only way to go loco for local fresh fruit spreads!

vendors.name: Evan Jed Memmott
vendors.description: I'm a Utah boy. Born and raised. With a love of the outdoors, and a penchant for darkness and solitude, I'm drawing and printing and building my way through life. Not content with a single medium or topic, I make a wide variety of things, all connected with similar themes and aesthetics. Come have a close look, and you'll get a glimpse into the various ideas that dominate my mind, and the details that I use to express them.

vendors.name: SaltyHoney Wax
vendors.description: Handcrafted with all natural ingredients from Utah, Saltyhoney is a fine facial care system from your mustache to your beard. Our main products are Beard Balm, Beard Elixir and Mustache wax. A couple of our key ingredients include bees wax and honey that come straight from Utah. Other ingredients include jojoba oil, vitamin E, shae butter, and other essential oils. Blake has been using these products for over a year and has seen first hand the benefits from using these products. We have participated in Beard and Mustache competitions within the Northern part of Utah. Not only have we taken our products to sell, we have also given a prize package to the lucky winners. In the past Blake has also competed using his own products and has placed 1st and 2nd.  We take pride in the little details by making small batches to insure quality. We have created our own labels and we hand stamp our products as well. We love to support our local community.

vendors.name: Michael Miller-Imperiale
vendors.description: I am a small time artist blacksmith making all sorts of useful things for home and camp! Come on by, and let's talk shop.

vendors.name: Critters + Company by lizzie dee
vendors.description: Hi, I'm Liz. However when my love for crafting first began I went by Lizzie. I was 10. I took sewing classes near my home at the mouth of Millcreek Canyon, right here in Salt Lake City. I learned how to sew and my love for creating blossomed. Now 20 years later, as a mama, I have refined my skills and started sewing little stuffed friends for my girls. Thus, Critters + Company was born.

vendors.name: Google Fiber
vendors.description: Google Fiber starts with a connection that's up to 1,000 megabits per second. Instant downloads. TV like no other. And endless possibilities.

vendors.name: Caffe Ibis
vendors.description: Caffe Ibis® is a family owned and operated award winning 'Green Business' and artisan custom coffee roasting house founded in 1976 by Randy Wirth and Sally Sears. Our focus is on Triple Certified, Organic, Fair Trade, and Smithsonian Shade Grown 'Bird-Friendly' coffee from around the world.

vendors.name: Andy Joy Chase
vendors.description: Andy Joy Chase is an painter and printmaker currently living in Salt Lake City. She received a Bachelor of Fine Arts with an emphasis in 2D from Weber State University in 2010. She currently works at Signed and Numbered and BUG Farms. Lately she has been experimenting with small drawings on repurposed wood.

vendors.name: Love Street Salvage
vendors.description: Love Street Salvage is a new vintage clothing boutique in the heart of downtown Sugar House. We sell vintage women's clothing and accessories from the 60's, 70's and more! Some of the pieces have been what we like to call rehashed, or refashioned to be more wearable and one-of-a kind! We can also do custom refashioning for your vintage pieces. Come check out our large and very affordable selection today! We are located in the lower level of One World Gifts at 2166 S Highland Dr, open Tues-Sat 11-7.

vendors.name: Bitty Kids Design
vendors.description: Hi! My name is Holly Hackett.  When my sweet baby girl was born my husband and I couldn't wait to take her out into the light and show her the world. Of course we needed to take all our baby stuff with us, too. I love sewing and designing, so I went right to work on a convenient, minimal way to carry everything we need. It's a kind of diaper purse that takes the hassle out of on the go parenting. Happy Adventuring!

vendors.name: The Land of Salt
vendors.description: We are Erica and Nick, owners and operators of The Land of Salt. We sell hand crafted crystal and gemstone jewelry and stained glass containers and terrariums. We use various methods to create our products including silversmithing, electroplating, and traditional stained glass techniques. We operate out of our home studio in downtown Salt Lake City. While we aren’t busy creating, we can be found riding our bikes around town, laughing at our French Bulldog’s crazy antics, or enjoying the local cuisine.

vendors.name: Turkish American Cultural Center
vendors.description: Was born and raised in Turkey.  Mother of 4. Gained BA  in Turkish Language and Literature. Taught Turkish for several years. Subbing at Jordan and Canyons School Districts for one year. Outreach coordinator of Turkish American Cultural Center. Organize cooking classes, Saturday School, coffee night series, community and public services, article clubs,and attending Living Traditional Festival over 4 years.

vendors.name: Nikki Jackson
vendors.description: I make original stained glass home decor and items for your self.  All pieces are handcrafted and designed by me.  I try to use recycled and unique glass that has good texture and fits the piece.  Not everyone can have stained glass windows in their house so I try to create items that give some of the beauty of colored light.

vendors.name: mike murdock
vendors.description: Painter, illustrator and guy who likes to make stuff.

vendors.name: Brackitz
vendors.description: Brackitz is the only construction toy that actually lets kids design any structure they envision – anything! Our award-winning, one-of-a-kind Brackitz enable connections at any angle, allowing kids to use real-life architectural and engineering principles to create large-scale, gravity-defying, 3-D structures – with no limitations!
vendors.categories: Children's Items, DIY Engineer, Engineering, Science, Technology, Wood/Metal

vendors.name: Salt City Lamp Works
vendors.description: One-of-a-kind lamps handcrafted from repurposed cigar boxes in Salt Lake City, Utah. You can find me building cigar box lamps in my outdoor workshop most nights as the sun sets over the Great Salt Lake. After I put the finishing touches on a lamp, I plug it in and revel in the soft glow as I savor a glass of whiskey and a cigar from Beehive Cigars; the same shop from which I hand-select the unassuming cigar boxes that become works of art. I pour my heart into each cigar box lamp I make; a labor of love that shows in my craftsmanship and attention to detail.

vendors.name: The Rock Music
vendors.description: The Rock Music is an independent collaboration of musicians who are dedicated to writing, recording and performing relevant Christ-centered music without compromise.  Based out the Rock Church in Salt Lake City, the Rock Music seeks to love God, bless the saints, and win the lost through its powerful messages and transcendent musicianship.  With over a dozen bands committed to creating original worship music, the Rock Music collaboratively displays a unified message through a diversified sound.

vendors.name: Que Sera Clothing
vendors.description: Que Sera is a team effort of two mom's who wanted to create clothing for our little boys.  There were never items in the big box stores that we felt fit our styles.  From there we have branched out to making little girl items as well.  We make harem pants and screened tee-shirts but are working on new designs all the time.

vendors.name: ArtFirst ArtePrimero
vendors.description: The Day of the Dead is a grand celebration of life itself! Marla Love continues her generational family tradition of creating sugar skulls and folkloric art for Dia de Muertos, Day of the Dead. Marla Love is involved in many local festivals highlighting her talents and passion for continuing the traditions of the festive holiday; Living Traditions, Foster Care Chalk Festival, Thanksgiving Point & Utah Cultural Celebration Center’s Day of the Dead Celebrations. Year round her family and Marla prepare with traditional sugar skulls, frosting to decorate and sculpting altars for the offering. Year round Marla teaches art in Español in Spanish through ArtFirst ArtePrimero. From pre Columbian times, El Día de los Muertos, the Day of the Dead has been celebrated in Mexico, and other Latin countries. This is a very special ritual, since it is the day in which the living remember their departed relatives.  Sometimes, when people of other cultures hear for the first time about the celebration of the Day of the Dead, they mistakenly think it must be: gruesome, terrifying, scary, ugly and sad. Nothing further from the truth, Day of the Dead is a beautiful ritual in which Mexicans happily and lovingly remember their loved relatives that have died.  Much like when we go to a graveyard to leave some lovely flowers on a tomb of a relative. To many not just the Latin American community, Day of the Dead is an important time to celebrate those loved ones who have passed away.

vendors.name: House of Good JuJu LLC
vendors.description: Positive Mystiques for You and Your Home! We are Purveyors of Good JuJu! Spiritual, Mystical and Magickal Mists, Soy Candles, Oils, Washes, and JuJus'. Everything to Cleanse, Bless, Protect, and bring Abundance to your home and space. All items crafted with Positive Intent. Always conjured with White Light and crafted when the moon is right! Tools to inspire positive change. Natural ingredient items that are a perfect accompaniment to Yoga, Meditation, Energy and Spiritual work. Our products are meant to inspire and aid you on your Spiritual Journey. Healing with Love, Light, and Good JuJu.

vendors.name: Blackburn Studio
vendors.description: As an artist, I'm drawn to the play of negative spaces against positive spaces.  As a photographer, I'm drawn to the possibilities of light and light shaping.  As Sociologist, I'm drawn to the human condition and the role it plays.  As a human, I'm drawn to how deeply emotional we all are, but how easily we forget.  I am hugely influenced from artists and photographers from the 40's and 50's.  Their passion, emotion, and emphasis on dramatic lighting speaks deeply to me. When working on a project I may have pre-conceived ideas of how it might turn out, but look forward to elements of surprise that a person, place, or time can have and allow the idea to come to a life of its own.  Challenges allow me to re-evaluate what I'm doing and stretch my skills into new areas. My work focuses on people and my strength focuses on individuals.  I enjoy pulling emotions out of people that are genuine and sincere.  With my recent work with film and wet plate, I have enjoyed the stillness and solitude this has provided the subject and requires them to stretch beyond themselves as well. I utilize various mediums and format in my artwork and am always pushing myself to learn new skills.  Moving back to film has allowed me to slow down and be more thoughtful.  Learning wet plate and cyanotype printing gives me the satisfaction of hand crafting a piece of art from start to finish. My goal is simple to produce work that will stand the test of time not only physically, but keep people coming back and rediscovering the art anew time and time again.
vendors.categories: Antiques, Mixed Media, Photography, Retro, Vintage, Wood/Metal

vendors.name: Blue Cricket Design
vendors.description: The classic handcraft of embroidery is making a comeback with a fresh new look! 'Hoop-a-loops' by Blue Cricket Design are simple and fun embroidery kits ready to inspire the next generation of crafters. Hand drawn patterns, premium muslin and beautiful color combinations     make embroidery cool again! Young creators aren't the only ones who will adore these kit! If you love to see a project form before your eyes, a Hoop-a-loop is just what you need! Embroidery kits, hand embroidered necklaces and DIY Mini Hoop Pendant kits will all help spark your creative side! Happy stitching!

vendors.name: Silver Wolf Artistry
vendors.description: Steven has been working with metal since 2006 and started Silver Wolf in 2010. His interest in metal work led him to peruse a Bachelor’s Degree in Metals at Arizona State University. The techniques he learned at ASU led him to start incorporating different techniques in his artwork and use ancient designs in new ways. Steven has been recognized for his metal work in City Weekly Best of Utah in 2012 and has had work shown in Arizona State University 2013 juried undergrad exhibition.

vendors.name: The Leonardo Museum
vendors.description: Located in the heart of Salt Lake City, The Leonardo is Utah’s Center for Exploration.  Here visitors of all ages can exercise their curiosity, their creativity and experience one-of-a-kind, interactive exhibits and an ongoing calendar of public programs, workshops and classes. For more information about The Leonardo and current exhibits and public programs please visit: www.theleonardo.org
vendors.categories: Children's Items, Craft Food, DIY Engineer, Electronics, Engineering, Graffiti/Street Art, Mixed Media, Painting

vendors.name: Dolce Bella by Erin
vendors.description: Hi!  I'm Erin and I love to make and create beautiful and mouth watering Pastries.  I have always loved being in the kitchen ever since I was a little girl.  I learned a lot from my mother in my early years, and then I had wonderful encouraging teachers through out my adolescents. I was then able to pursue my dream of Culinary School, which helped my truly realize my passion for preparing beautiful, tasty food. Being able to be apart of so many happy celebrations wether elaborate or simple saturday morning outings, brings me such joy. I love to see reactions of pure delight from my customers.I use the highest of quality ingredients, including local growers/ millers/ farmers to produce my pastries.  I truly believe that doing what you love shows (and in my case tastes) in your end product.  I love what I do simple as that and i LOVE sharing it with those around me.

vendors.name: The Cotton Floozy and The Happy Valley Crafters
vendors.description: Marie Brian learned how to stitch when she was young and fresh and idealistic. Then she forgot all about it for twenty years until she joined a local Stitch & Bitch group. Marie became The Cotton Floozy and the group became The Happy Valley Crafters. Currently, the Happy Valley Crafters include: The Socially Awkward Stitcher, The Vintage Stitcher, and Dame Toadstool. Each member of the group stitches in her own unique way, creating needle works that are handmade with much love and gentle swearing. The Cotton Floozy's needlework has been featured in The Huffington Post, .Mic, the U.K.'s Independent News, The Salt Lake Tribune, Slug Magazine, and Catalyst.

vendors.name: Becca Clason
vendors.description: Becca Clason is a Salt Lake City-based lettering artist. She aims to inspire women towards a healthy lifestyle and to be a cheerleader for nutrition and fitness through her hand-lettered Cheerletter products.

vendors.name: Radninjas
vendors.description: Radninjas used to be know as Radseams.  We changed the name but we still have the ever popular ninjas made from repurposed fabrics and accessorizing with bow ties, bows and mustaches.  We have monster friends and bags made from repurposed fabrics.  We will also have some baby rattles and ninja rattles made from new fabrics.

vendors.name: Welt
vendors.description: Welt is the furniture design, upholstery and repair shop of Colton Corry.

vendors.name: Bitchin' Stitches
vendors.description: Krista Chandler and Danie Tolman formed Bitchin' Stitches with a admiration of DIY ethic, as well as their passion for their craft. Danie, a printmaker and book artist, first met Krista, a needlepoint artist, while studying art at Snow College. By collaborating their ideology and unique skill sets they formed an inseparable bond through their creations.  Their work features wearable artist patches, one of a kind prints, cross stitches, artist books, and other various forms of wearable art.

vendors.name: Eleora Nelson
vendors.description: I live and love to draw cartoons, fantasy worlds and people! I have been drawing and painting traditionally for 15 years. Although I am a wizard with colored pencils, I really enjoy working digitally. Over the past year I have improved my graphic design and 2D animation skills working on a mobile app! I love doing festivals because they get me out drawing the world around me! I absolutely love doing caricatures of people I meet.

vendors.name: Paisley Pear & Co.
vendors.description: We are three sister in cahoots! We were raised learning how to garden, cook, sew, and create. We love to cook and eat good clean food. The transition to making clean pure body products was inspired by our children, who have allergies and sensitivities. We love them so much we wanted to share. Our products are always free of artificial fragrances, chemicals, dyes, artificial preservatives, sulfates, parabans, mineral oil, petroleum, chlorine, and phosphates. We use only minimally refined, organic, clean, pure and natural oils, butters, herbs and essential oils. We won't sell anything we don't us on ourselves or our families.

vendors.name: Inkling Scents
vendors.description: Inkling Scents was created by sisters Tiff and Sarah in 2013.  We are great partners as we can be serious and silly, spiritual and irreverent, creative and practical, fancy-schmancy and down-to-earth - somehow all at the same time!  We love creating our healthy, pure, sexy oil fragrances and hope to share them with the world!

vendors.name: Amour Spreads
vendors.description: We are a small family owned business located in Salt Lake City near Liberty Park.  We began making our handcrafted jams & marmalades in 2011 because we love wholesome food made without artificial ingredients of any kind.  Each jar of our delicious preserves is made only with in-season, fresh fruit, a touch of organic cane sugar and a splash of organic lemon juice.  We source local fruit first and suport Utah farmers from Mt. Pleasant to Bear Lake. We make each small batch in traditional copper jam pans WITHOUT commercial pectins to create the best jam possible for you!

vendors.name: Mozdykuchen Toasting Bread
vendors.description: Mozdykuchen is an old-world, brioche sweet bread, hand made in Salt Lake City, Utah, and based on the Mozdy family heirloom recipe that has been handed down for over two centuries. Michael Mozdy has developed four gourmet variations in addition to the original Polish sweet bread passed down to him. He special orders locally milled flour in its most natural state, without added enrichments or dough conditioners, and uses only other natural, wholesome ingredients to stay faithful to this heritage bread delight.
